{"chunk_order_number": 399, "name": "Chunk 399", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "By this time Jim was gone for the raft. I was just a-biling with\\ncuriosity; and I says to myself, Tom Sawyer wouldn\u2019t back out now, and\\nso I won\u2019t either; I\u2019m a-going to see what\u2019s going on here. So I\\ndropped on my hands and knees in the little passage, and crept aft in\\nthe dark till there warn\u2019t but one stateroom betwixt me and the\\ncross-hall of the texas. Then in there I see a man stretched on the\\nfloor and tied hand and foot, and two men standing over him, and one of\\nthem had a dim lantern in his hand, and the other one had a pistol.\\nThis one kept pointing the pistol at the man\u2019s head on the floor, and\\nsaying:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:08Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 403", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201c\u2019Deed you _ain\u2019t!_ You never said no truer thing \u2019n that, you bet\\nyou.\u201d And once he said: \u201cHear him beg! and yit if we hadn\u2019t got the\\nbest of him and tied him he\u2019d a killed us both. And what _for?_ Jist\\nfor noth\u2019n. Jist because we stood on our _rights_\u2014that\u2019s what for. But\\nI lay you ain\u2019t a-goin\u2019 to threaten nobody any more, Jim Turner. Put\\n_up_ that pistol, Bill.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 403, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:08Z"}

{"name": "Chunk_407", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cBless yo\u2019 heart for them words, Jake Packard! {"name": "Chunk 408", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "Packard didn\u2019t take no notice of that, but hung up his lantern on a\\nnail and started towards where I was there in the dark, and motioned\\nBill to come. I crawfished as fast as I could about two yards, but the\\nboat slanted so that I couldn\u2019t make very good time; so to keep from\\ngetting run over and catched I crawled into a stateroom on the upper\\nside. The man came a-pawing along in the dark, and when Packard got to\\nmy stateroom, he says:", "chunk_order_number": 408, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:09Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 409, "text": "\u201cHere\u2014come in here.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 409", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cHere\u2014come in here.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:09Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 410, "name": "Chunk 410", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "And in he come, and Bill after him. But before they got in I was up in\\nthe upper berth, cornered, and sorry I come. Then they stood there,\\nwith their hands on the ledge of the berth, and talked. I couldn\u2019t see\\nthem, but I could tell where they was by the whisky they\u2019d been having.\\nI was glad I didn\u2019t drink whisky; but it wouldn\u2019t made much difference\\nanyway, because most of the time they couldn\u2019t a treed me because I\\ndidn\u2019t breathe. I was too scared. And, besides, a body _couldn\u2019t_\\nbreathe and hear such talk. They talked low and earnest. Bill wanted to\\nkill Turner. He says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:09Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 411, "name": "Chunk 411", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cHe\u2019s said he\u2019ll tell, and he will. If we was to give both our shares\\nto him _now_ it wouldn\u2019t make no difference after the row and the way\\nwe\u2019ve served him. Shore\u2019s you\u2019re born, he\u2019ll turn State\u2019s evidence; now\\nyou hear _me_. I\u2019m for putting him out of his troubles.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:10Z"}

I\u2019m for putting him out of his troubles.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 411, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:10Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 412, "text": "\u201cSo\u2019m I,\u201d says Packard, very quiet.", "name": "Chunk 412", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cSo\u2019m I,\u201d says Packard, very quiet.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:10Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 413, "name": "Chunk 413", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cBlame it, I\u2019d sorter begun to think you wasn\u2019t. Well, then, that\u2019s all\\nright. Le\u2019s go and do it.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:10Z"}

{"name": "Unspecified", "description": "Speaker in dialogue", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cBlame it, I\u2019d sorter begun to think you wasn\u2019t. Well, then, that\u2019s all\\nright. Le\u2019s go and do it.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 413, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:10Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 414, "name": "Chunk 414", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cHold on a minute; I hain\u2019t had my say yit. You listen to me.\\nShooting\u2019s good, but there\u2019s quieter ways if the thing\u2019s _got_ to be\\ndone. But what _I_ say is this: it ain\u2019t good sense to go court\u2019n\\naround after a halter if you can git at what you\u2019re up to in some way\\nthat\u2019s jist as good and at the same time don\u2019t bring you into no resks.\\nAin\u2019t that so?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:10Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 415, "text": "\\\"You bet it is. But how you goin\u2019 to manage it this time?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 415", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cYou bet it is. But how you goin\u2019 to manage it this time?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:11Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 416, "name": "Chunk 416", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, my idea is this: we\u2019ll rustle around and gather up whatever\\npickins we\u2019ve overlooked in the staterooms, and shove for shore and\\nhide the truck. Then we\u2019ll wait. Now I say it ain\u2019t a-goin\u2019 to be\\nmore\u2019n two hours befo\u2019 this wrack breaks up and washes off down the\\nriver. See? He\u2019ll be drownded, and won\u2019t have nobody to blame for it\\nbut his own self. I reckon that\u2019s a considerble sight better \u2019n killin\u2019\\nof him. I\u2019m unfavorable to killin\u2019 a man as long as you can git aroun\u2019\\nit; it ain\u2019t good sense, it ain\u2019t good morals. Ain\u2019t I right?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:11Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 421, "name": "Chunk 421", "chapter": "CHAPTER XII.", "chunk": "\u201cQuick, Jim, it ain\u2019t no time for fooling around and moaning; there\u2019s a\\ngang of murderers in yonder, and if we don\u2019t hunt up their boat and set\\nher drifting down the river so these fellows can\u2019t get away from the\\nwreck there\u2019s one of \u2019em going to be in a bad fix. But if we find their\\nboat we can put _all_ of \u2019em in a bad fix\u2014for the Sheriff \u2019ll get \u2019em.\\nQuick\u2014hurry! I\u2019ll hunt the labboard side, you hunt the stabboard. You\\nstart at the raft, and\u2014\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:11Z"}

{"name": "CHAPTER XIII.", "description": "Chapter XIII of ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "Well, I catched my breath and most fainted. Shut up on a wreck with\\nsuch a gang as that! But it warn\u2019t no time to be sentimentering. We\u2019d\\n_got_ to find that boat now\u2014had to have it for ourselves. So we went\\na-quaking and shaking down the stabboard side, and slow work it was,\\ntoo\u2014seemed a week before we got to the stern. No sign of a boat. Jim\\nsaid he didn\u2019t believe he could go any further\u2014so scared he hadn\u2019t\\nhardly any strength left, he said. But I said, come on, if we get left\\non this wreck we are in a fix, sure. So on we prowled again. We struck\\nfor the stern of the texas, and found it, and then scrabbled along\\nforwards on the skylight, hanging on from shutter to shutter, for the\\nedge of the skylight was in the water. When we got pretty close to the\\ncross-hall door, there was the skiff, sure enough! I could just barely\\nsee her. I felt ever so thankful. In another second I would a been\\naboard of her, but just then the door opened. One of the men stuck his\\nhead out onl...", "chunk_order_number": 423, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:12Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 427, "name": "Chunk 427", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "I couldn\u2019t hardly hang on to the shutters, I was so weak. But Bill\\nsays:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:12Z"}

{"text": "\u201cHold on\u2014\u2019d you go through him?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 428, "name": "Chunk 428", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cHold on\u2014\u2019d you go through him?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T14:30:00Z"}

{"order_number": 429, "text": "\u201cNo. Didn\u2019t you?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 429", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cNo. Didn\u2019t you?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 429, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:12Z"}

{"text": "\u201cNo. So he\u2019s got his share o\u2019 the cash yet.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 430", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cNo. So he\u2019s got his share o\u2019 the cash yet.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 430, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:12Z"}

{"order_number": 431, "text": "\\\"Well, then, come along; no use to take truck and leave money.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 431", "description": "Text content passage from chapter 13", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, then, come along; no use to take truck and leave money.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 431, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:13Z"}

{"order_number": 432, "text": "\u201cSay, won\u2019t he suspicion what we\u2019re up to?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 432", "description": "Text passage within Chapter XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cSay, won\u2019t he suspicion what we\u2019re up to?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 432, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:13Z"}

{"text": "So they got out and went in.", "chunk_order_number": 434, "name": "Chunk 434", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "So they got out and went in.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 435, "text": "The door slammed to because it was on the careened side; and in a half second I was in the boat, and Jim come tumbling after me. I out with my knife and cut the rope, and away we went!", "name": "Chunk_435", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "The door slammed to because it was on the careened side; and in a half\\nsecond I was in the boat, and Jim come tumbling after me. I out with my\\nknife and cut the rope, and away we went!", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:13Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 436, "text": "We didn\u2019t touch an oar, and we didn\u2019t speak nor whisper, nor hardly\\neven breathe. {"name": "Worry", "description": "Feeling of concern", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "Then Jim manned the oars, and we took out after our raft. Now was the\\nfirst time that I begun to worry about the men\u2014I reckon I hadn\u2019t had\\ntime to before. I begun to think how dreadful it was, even for\\nmurderers, to be in such a fix. I says to myself, there ain\u2019t no\\ntelling but I might come to be a murderer myself yet, and then how\\nwould _I_ like it? So says I to Jim:", "chunk_order_number": 438, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:14Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 439, "text": "\u201cThe first light we see we\u2019ll land a hundred yards below it or above it, in a place where it\u2019s a good hiding-place for you and the skiff, and then I\u2019ll go and fix up some kind of a yarn, and get somebody to go for that gang and get them out of their scrape, so they can be hung when their time comes.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 439", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cThe first light we see we\u2019ll land a hundred yards below it or above\\nit, in a place where it\u2019s a good hiding-place for you and the skiff,\\nand then I\u2019ll go and fix up some kind of a yarn, and get somebody to go\\nfor that gang and get them out of their scrape, so they can be hung\\nwhen their time comes.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:14Z"}

{"name": "hanging", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cThe first light we see we\u2019ll land a hundred yards below it or above\\nit, in a place where it\u2019s a good hiding-place for you and the skiff,\\nand then I\u2019ll go and fix up some kind of a yarn, and get somebody to go\\nfor that gang and get them out of their scrape, so they can be hung\\nwhen their time comes.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 439, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:14Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 440, "name": "Chunk 440", "description": "Text content passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "But that idea was a failure; for pretty soon it begun to storm again,\\nand this time worse than ever. The rain poured down, and never a light\\nshowed; everybody in bed, I reckon. We boomed along down the river,\\nwatching for lights and watching for our raft. After a long time the\\nrain let up, but the clouds stayed, and the lightning kept whimpering,\\nand by-and-by a flash showed us a black thing ahead, floating, and we\\nmade for it.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

After a long time the\\nrain let up, but the clouds stayed, and the lightning kept whimpering,\\nand by-and-by a flash showed us a black thing ahead, floating, and we\\nmade for it.", "chunk_order_number": 440, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 441, "name": "Chunk 441", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "It was the raft, and mighty glad was we to get aboard of it again. We\\nseen a light now away down to the right, on shore. So I said I would go\\nfor it. The skiff was half full of plunder which that gang had stole\\nthere on the wreck. We hustled it on to the raft in a pile, and I told\\nJim to float along down, and show a light when he judged he had gone\\nabout two mile, and keep it burning till I come; then I manned my oars\\nand shoved for the light. As I got down towards it, three or four more\\nshowed\u2014up on a hillside. It was a village. I closed in above the shore\\nlight, and laid on my oars and floated. As I went by, I see it was a\\nlantern hanging on the jackstaff of a double-hull ferry-boat. I skimmed\\naround for the watchman, a-wondering whereabouts he slept; and\\nby-and-by I found him roosting on the bitts, forward, with his head\\ndown between his knees. I gave his shoulder two or three little shoves,\\nand begun to cry.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:15Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 442, "name": "Chunk 442", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "He stirred up, in a kind of a startlish way; but when he see it was only\\nme, he took a good gap and stretch, and then he says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 443", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cHello, what\u2019s up? Don\u2019t cry, bub. What\u2019s the trouble?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 443, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:15Z"}

{"name": "Conversation", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cHello, what\u2019s up? Don\u2019t cry, bub. What\u2019s the trouble?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 443, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:15Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 447, "name": "Chunk 447", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cOh, dang it now, _don\u2019t_ take on so; we all has to have our troubles,\\nand this\u2019n \u2019ll come out all right. What\u2019s the matter with \u2019em?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T14:37:15Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 448, "text": "\u201cThey\u2019re\u2014they\u2019re\u2014are you the watchman of the boat?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 448", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cThey\u2019re\u2014they\u2019re\u2014are you the watchman of the boat?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:15Z"}

{"name": "The Watchman", "description": "Watchman of the boat", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cThey\u2019re\u2014they\u2019re\u2014are you the watchman of the boat?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 448, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:15Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 449, "name": "Chunk 449", "description": "Text passage from chapter XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cYes,\u201d he says, kind of pretty-well-satisfied like. \u201cI\u2019m the captain\\nand the owner and the mate and the pilot and watchman and head\\ndeck-hand; and sometimes I\u2019m the freight and passengers. I ain\u2019t as\\nrich as old Jim Hornback, and I can\u2019t be so blame\u2019 generous and good to\\nTom, Dick and Harry as what he is, and slam around money the way he\\ndoes; but I\u2019ve told him a many a time \u2019t I wouldn\u2019t trade places with\\nhim; for, says I, a sailor\u2019s life\u2019s the life for me, and I\u2019m derned if\\n_I\u2019d_ live two mile out o\u2019 town, where there ain\u2019t nothing ever goin\u2019\\non, not for all his spondulicks and as much more on top of it. Says I\u2014\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-15T16:42:50Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 453, "text": "\\\"Why, pap and mam and sis and Miss Hooker; and if you\u2019d take your ferry-boat and go up there\u2014\\\"", "name": "Chunk 453", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, pap and mam and sis and Miss Hooker; and if you\u2019d take your\\nferry-boat and go up there\u2014\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:37:16Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 454, "text": "\u201cUp where? Where are they?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 454", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cUp where? Where are they?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:16Z"}

{"content": "\\\"On the wreck.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 455", "description": "Text chunk from Chapter XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cOn the wreck.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 455, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:16Z"}

{"content": "\u201cWhat wreck?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 456, "name": "Chunk 456", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat wreck?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:16Z"}

{"content": "\u201cWhy, there ain\u2019t but one.\u201d", "name": "Chunk of Text", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, there ain\u2019t but one.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 457, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:16Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 460, "name": "Chunk 460", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cGood land! what are they doin\u2019 _there_, for gracious sakes?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:16Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 461, "text": "\\\"Well, they didn\u2019t go there a-purpose.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 461", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, they didn\u2019t go there a-purpose.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T10:50:40Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 462, "text": "\u201cI bet they didn\u2019t! Why, great goodness, there ain\u2019t no chance for \u2019em\\nif they don\u2019t git off mighty quick! Miss Hooker was a-visiting up there to the town\u2014\u201d", "name": "Chunk 463", "description": "Text chunk from chapter XIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cEasy enough. Miss Hooker was a-visiting up there to the town\u2014\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:16Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 464, "text": "\\\"Yes, Booth\u2019s Landing\u2014go on.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 464", "description": "Text segment from chapter XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cYes, Booth\u2019s Landing\u2014go on.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:16Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 465, "name": "Chunk 465", "description": "Text segment from chapter XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cShe was a-visiting there at Booth\u2019s Landing, and just in the edge of\\nthe evening she started over with her nigger woman in the horse-ferry\\nto stay all night at her friend\u2019s house, Miss What-you-may-call-her I\\ndisremember her name\u2014and they lost their steering-oar, and swung around\\nand went a-floating down, stern first, about two mile, and\\nsaddle-baggsed on the wreck, and the ferryman and the nigger woman and\\nthe horses was all lost, but Miss Hooker she made a grab and got aboard\\nthe wreck. Well, about an hour after dark we come along down in our\\ntrading-scow, and it was so dark we didn\u2019t notice the wreck till we was\\nright on it; and so _we_ saddle-baggsed; but all of us was saved but\\nBill Whipple\u2014and oh, he _was_ the best cretur!\u2014I most wish\u2019t it had\\nbeen me, I do.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:16Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 467, "name": "Chunk 467", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, we hollered and took on, but it\u2019s so wide there we couldn\u2019t make\\nnobody hear. So pap said somebody got to get ashore and get help\\nsomehow. I was the only one that could swim, so I made a dash for it,\\nand Miss Hooker she said if I didn\u2019t strike help sooner, come here and\\nhunt up her uncle, and he\u2019d fix the thing. I made the land about a mile\\nbelow, and been fooling along ever since, trying to get people to do\\nsomething, but they said, \u2018What, in such a night and such a current?\\nThere ain\u2019t no sense in it; go for the steam ferry.\u2019 Now if you\u2019ll go\\nand\u2014\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:17Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 470, "name": "Chunk 470", "description": "Text passage from chapter XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "\u201cGreat guns! is _he_ her uncle? Looky here, you break for that light\\nover yonder-way, and turn out west when you git there, and about a\\nquarter of a mile out you\u2019ll come to the tavern; tell \u2019em to dart you\\nout to Jim Hornback\u2019s, and he\u2019ll foot the bill. And don\u2019t you fool\\naround any, because he\u2019ll want to know the news. Tell him I\u2019ll have his\\nniece all safe before he can get to town. Hump yourself, now; I\u2019m\\na-going up around the corner here to roust out my engineer.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:17Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 471, "name": "Chunk 471", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "I struck for the light, but as soon as he turned the corner I went back\\nand got into my skiff and bailed her out, and then pulled up shore in\\nthe easy water about six hundred yards, and tucked myself in among some\\nwoodboats; for I couldn\u2019t rest easy till I could see the ferry-boat\\nstart. But take it all around, I was feeling ruther comfortable on\\naccounts of taking all this trouble for that gang, for not many would a\\ndone it. I wished the widow knowed about it. I judged she would be\\nproud of me for helping these rapscallions, because rapscallions and\\ndead beats is the kind the widow and good people takes the most\\ninterest in.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:18Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 473, "name": "Chunk 473", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIII.", "chunk": "Then here comes the ferry-boat; so I shoved for the middle of the river\\non a long down-stream slant; and when I judged I was out of eye-reach, I\\nlaid on my oars, and looked back and see her go and smell around the\\nwreck for Miss Hooker\u2019s remainders, because the captain would know her\\nuncle Hornback would want them; and then pretty soon the ferry-boat give\\nit up and went for the shore, and I laid into my work and went\\na-booming down the river.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:51:20Z"}

We hadn\u2019t ever been this rich before in neither of\\nour lives. The seegars was prime. We laid off all the afternoon in the\\nwoods talking, and me reading the books, and having a general good\\ntime. I told Jim all about what happened inside the wreck and at the\\nferry-boat, and I said these kinds of things was adventures; but he said\\nhe didn\u2019t want no more adventures. {"chunk_order_number": 489, "name": "Chunk 489", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, yes, dat\u2019s so; I\u2014I\u2019d done forgot it. A harem\u2019s a bo\u2019d\u2019n-house, I\\nreck\u2019n. Mos\u2019 likely dey has rackety times in de nussery. En I reck\u2019n de\\nwives quarrels considable; en dat \u2019crease de racket. Yit dey say\\nSollermun de wises\u2019 man dat ever live\u2019. I doan\u2019 take no stock in dat.\\nBekase why: would a wise man want to live in de mids\u2019 er sich a\\nblim-blammin\u2019 all de time? No\u2014\u2019deed he wouldn\u2019t. A wise man \u2019ud take en\\nbuil\u2019 a biler-factry; en den he could shet _down_ de biler-factry when\\nhe want to res\u2019.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:20Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 492, "text": "\u201cYes, the widow told me all about it.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 492", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cYes, the widow told me all about it.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:20Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 493, "name": "Chunk 493", "description": "Text segment from chapter XIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201c_Well_, den! Warn\u2019 dat de beatenes\u2019 notion in de worl\u2019? You jes\u2019 take\\nen look at it a minute. Dah\u2019s de stump, dah\u2014dat\u2019s one er de women;\\nheah\u2019s you\u2014dat\u2019s de yuther one; I\u2019s Sollermun; en dish yer dollar\\nbill\u2019s de chile. Bofe un you claims it. What does I do? Does I shin\\naroun\u2019 mongs\u2019 de neighbors en fine out which un you de bill _do_ b\u2019long\\nto, en han\u2019 it over to de right one, all safe en soun\u2019, de way dat\\nanybody dat had any gumption would? No; I take en whack de bill in\\n_two_, en give half un it to you, en de yuther half to de yuther woman.\\nDat\u2019s de way Sollermun was gwyne to do wid de chile. Now I want to ast\\nyou: what\u2019s de use er dat half a bill?\u2014can\u2019t buy noth\u2019n wid it. En what\\nuse is a half a chile? I wouldn\u2019 give a dern for a million un um.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:20Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 494, "name": "Chunk 494", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cBut hang it, Jim, you\u2019ve clean missed the point\u2014blame it, you\u2019ve\\nmissed it a thousand mile.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T12:00:00Z"}

{"order_number": 495, "name": "Chunk 495", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWho? Me? Go \u2019long. Doan\u2019 talk to _me_ \u2019bout yo\u2019 pints. I reck\u2019n I\\nknows sense when I sees it; en dey ain\u2019 no sense in sich doin\u2019s as dat.\\nDe \u2019spute warn\u2019t \u2019bout a half a chile, de \u2019spute was \u2019bout a whole\\nchile; en de man dat think he kin settle a \u2019spute \u2019bout a whole chile\\nwid a half a chile doan\u2019 know enough to come in out\u2019n de rain. Doan\u2019\\ntalk to me \u2019bout Sollermun, Huck, I knows him by de back.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 495, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:20Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 497, "name": "Chunk 497", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cBlame de point! I reck\u2019n I knows what I knows. En mine you, de _real_\\npint is down furder\u2014it\u2019s down deeper. It lays in de way Sollermun was\\nraised. You take a man dat\u2019s got on\u2019y one or two chillen; is dat man\\ngwyne to be waseful o\u2019 chillen? No, he ain\u2019t; he can\u2019t \u2019ford it. _He_\\nknow how to value \u2019em. But you take a man dat\u2019s got \u2019bout five million\\nchillen runnin\u2019 roun\u2019 de house, en it\u2019s diffunt. _He_ as soon chop a\\nchile in two as a cat. Dey\u2019s plenty mo\u2019. A chile er two, mo\u2019 er less,\\nwarn\u2019t no consekens to Sollermun, dad fatch him!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"name": "Value of Children", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cBlame de point! I reck\u2019n I knows what I knows. En mine you, de _real_\\npint is down furder\u2014it\u2019s down deeper. {"chunk_order_number": 498, "name": "Chunk 498", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "I never see such a nigger. If he got a notion in his head once, there\\nwarn\u2019t no getting it out again. He was the most down on Solomon of any\\nnigger I ever see. So I went to talking about other kings, and let\\nSolomon slide. I told about Louis Sixteenth that got his head cut off\\nin France long time ago; and about his little boy the dolphin, that\\nwould a been a king, but they took and shut him up in jail, and some\\nsay he died there.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T12:00:00Z"}

{"order_number": 500, "name": "Chunk 500", "description": "\\\\\"But some says he got out and got away, and come to America.\\\\\"", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cBut some says he got out and got away, and come to America.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 500, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:20Z"}

{"order_number": 501, "text": "\u201cDat\u2019s good! But he\u2019ll be pooty lonesome\u2014dey ain\u2019 no kings here, is dey, Huck?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 501", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cDat\u2019s good! But he\u2019ll be pooty lonesome\u2014dey ain\u2019 no kings here, is\\ndey, Huck?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 501, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:21Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 503, "text": "\u201cDen he cain\u2019t git no situation. What he gwyne to do?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 503", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cDen he cain\u2019t git no situation. What he gwyne to do?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T14:20:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 510, "text": "\\\"Shucks, it ain\u2019t calling you anything. It\u2019s only saying, do you know\\nhow to talk French?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:51:30Z"}

{"name": "French Language", "description": "A language", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cShucks, it ain\u2019t calling you anything. {"chunk_order_number": 511, "text": "\\\"Well, den, why couldn\u2019t he _say_ it?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 511", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, den, why couldn\u2019t he _say_ it?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 512, "name": "Chunk 512", "description": "Text segment: \u201cWhy, he _is_ a-saying it. That\u2019s a Frenchman\u2019s _way_ of saying it.\u201d", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, he _is_ a-saying it. That\u2019s a Frenchman\u2019s _way_ of saying it.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 513, "text": "\u201cWell, it\u2019s a blame ridicklous way, en I doan\u2019 want to hear no mo\u2019 \u2019bout it. Dey ain\u2019 no sense in it.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 513", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, it\u2019s a blame ridicklous way, en I doan\u2019 want to hear no mo\u2019\\n\u2019bout it. Dey ain\u2019 no sense in it.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 514, "text": "\u201cLooky here, Jim; does a cat talk like we do?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 514", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cLooky here, Jim; does a cat talk like we do?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-04T09:30:00Z"}

{"name": "cat", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cLooky here, Jim; does a cat talk like we do?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 514, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-04T09:30:00Z"}

{"order_number": 515, "content": "\u201cNo, a cat don\u2019t.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 515", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, a cat don\u2019t.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 515, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T14:18:00Z"}

{"order_number": 516, "text": "\\\"Well, does a cow?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 516", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, does a cow?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 516, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 517, "content": "\u201cNo, a cow don\u2019t, nuther.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 517", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, a cow don\u2019t, nuther.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 518, "name": "Chunk 518", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cDoes a cat talk like a cow, or a cow talk like a cat?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"name": "Cat", "description": "Animal", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cDoes a cat talk like a cow, or a cow talk like a cat?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 518, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"content": "\u201cNo, dey don\u2019t.\u201d", "order_number": 519, "name": "Chunk 519", "description": "Text chunk within a chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, dey don\u2019t.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 519, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 520, "name": "Chunk 520", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cIt\u2019s natural and right for \u2019em to talk different from each other,\\nain\u2019t it?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:23Z"}

{"order_number": 522, "text": "\u201cAnd ain\u2019t it natural and right for a cat and a cow to talk different\\nfrom _us?_\u201d", "name": "Chunk 522", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cAnd ain\u2019t it natural and right for a cat and a cow to talk different\\nfrom _us?_\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 522, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:24Z"}

{"name": "cow", "description": "Animal in the text", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cAnd ain\u2019t it natural and right for a cat and a cow to talk different\\nfrom _us?_\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 522, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:24Z"}

{"name": "us", "description": "Characters in the text", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cAnd ain\u2019t it natural and right for a cat and a cow to talk different\\nfrom _us?_\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 522, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:24Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 524, "text": "\\\"Well, then, why ain\u2019t it natural and right for a _Frenchman_ to talk\\ndifferent from us? {"order_number": 528, "name": "Chunk 528", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, she ain\u2019t either of them.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 528, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:24Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 533, "name": "Chunk 533", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "We judged that three nights more would fetch us to Cairo, at the bottom\\nof Illinois, where the Ohio River comes in, and that was what we was\\nafter. We would sell the raft and get on a steamboat and go way up the\\nOhio amongst the free States, and then be out of trouble.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T18:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 534, "name": "Chunk 534", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "Well, the second night a fog begun to come on, and we made for a\\ntow-head to tie to, for it wouldn\u2019t do to try to run in a fog; but when\\nI paddled ahead in the canoe, with the line to make fast, there warn\u2019t\\nanything but little saplings to tie to. I passed the line around one of\\nthem right on the edge of the cut bank, but there was a stiff current,\\nand the raft come booming down so lively she tore it out by the roots\\nand away she went. I see the fog closing down, and it made me so sick\\nand scared I couldn\u2019t budge for most a half a minute it seemed to\\nme\u2014and then there warn\u2019t no raft in sight; you couldn\u2019t see twenty\\nyards. I jumped into the canoe and run back to the stern, and grabbed\\nthe paddle and set her back a stroke. But she didn\u2019t come. I was in\\nsuch a hurry I hadn\u2019t untied her. I got up and tried to untie her, but\\nI was so excited my hands shook so I couldn\u2019t hardly do anything with\\nthem.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:25Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 535, "name": "Chunk 535", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "As soon as I got started I took out after the raft, hot and heavy,\\nright down the tow-head. That was all right as far as it went, but the\\ntow-head warn\u2019t sixty yards long, and the minute I flew by the foot of\\nit I shot out into the solid white fog, and hadn\u2019t no more idea which\\nway I was going than a dead man.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-06-28T18:46:59Z"}

{"text": "Thinks I, it won\u2019t do to paddle; first I know I\u2019ll run into the bank or\\na tow-head or something; I got to set still and float, and yet it\u2019s\\nmighty fidgety business to have to hold your hands still at such a\\ntime. I whooped and listened. Away down there somewheres I hears a\\nsmall whoop, and up comes my spirits. I went tearing after it,\\nlistening sharp to hear it again. The next time it come, I see I warn\u2019t\\nheading for it, but heading away to the right of it. And the next time\\nI was heading away to the left of it\u2014and not gaining on it much either,\\nfor I was flying around, this way and that and t\u2019other, but it was\\ngoing straight ahead all the time.", "name": "Chunk 536", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "Thinks I, it won\u2019t do to paddle; first I know I\u2019ll run into the bank or\\na tow-head or something; I got to set still and float, and yet it\u2019s\\nmighty fidgety business to have to hold your hands still at such a\\ntime. I whooped and listened. Away down there somewheres I hears a\\nsmall whoop, and up comes my spirits. I went tearing after it,\\nlistening sharp to hear it again. The next time it come, I see I warn\u2019t\\nheading for it, but heading away to the right of it. And the next time\\nI was heading away to the left of it\u2014and not gaining on it much either,\\nfor I was flying around, this way and that and t\u2019other, but it was\\ngoing straight ahead all the time.", "chunk_order_number": 536, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"name": "somebody else", "description": "An actor", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "I did wish the fool would think to beat a tin pan, and beat it all the\\ntime, but he never did, and it was the still places between the whoops\\nthat was making the trouble for me. Well, I fought along, and directly\\nI hears the whoop _behind_ me. I was tangled good now. That was\\nsomebody else\u2019s whoop, or else I was turned around.", "chunk_order_number": 537, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T15:20:00Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 538", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "I throwed the paddle down. I heard the whoop again; it was behind me\\nyet, but in a different place; it kept coming, and kept changing its\\nplace, and I kept answering, till by-and-by it was in front of me\\nagain, and I knowed the current had swung the canoe\u2019s head down-stream,\\nand I was all right if that was Jim and not some other raftsman\\nhollering. I couldn\u2019t tell nothing about voices in a fog, for nothing\\ndon\u2019t look natural nor sound natural in a fog.", "chunk_order_number": 538, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T14:53:20Z"}

{"name": "the left", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "The whooping went on, and in about a minute I come a-booming down on a\\ncut bank with smoky ghosts of big trees on it, and the current throwed\\nme off to the left and shot by, amongst a lot of snags that fairly\\nroared, the currrent was tearing by them so swift.", "chunk_order_number": 539, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:26Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 540, "text": "In another second or two it was solid white and still again. I set perfectly still then, listening to my heart thump, and I reckon I didn\u2019t draw a breath while it thumped a hundred.", "name": "Chunk 540", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "In another second or two it was solid white and still again. I set\\nperfectly still then, listening to my heart thump, and I reckon I\\ndidn\u2019t draw a breath while it thumped a hundred.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:26Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 541, "name": "Chunk 541", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "I just give up then. I knowed what the matter was. That cut bank was an\\nisland, and Jim had gone down t\u2019other side of it. It warn\u2019t no tow-head\\nthat you could float by in ten minutes. It had the big timber of a\\nregular island; it might be five or six miles long and more than half a\\nmile wide.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:26Z"}

{"name": "floating along", "description": "The act of the narrator floating along the river", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "I kept quiet, with my ears cocked, about fifteen minutes, I reckon. I\\nwas floating along, of course, four or five miles an hour; but you\\ndon\u2019t ever think of that. No, you _feel_ like you are laying dead still\\non the water; and if a little glimpse of a snag slips by you don\u2019t\\nthink to yourself how fast _you\u2019re_ going, but you catch your breath\\nand think, my! how that snag\u2019s tearing along. If you think it ain\u2019t\\ndismal and lonesome out in a fog that way by yourself in the night, you\\ntry it once\u2014you\u2019ll see.", "chunk_order_number": 542, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T18:06:27Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 543, "name": "Chunk 543", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "Next, for about a half an hour, I whoops now and then; at last I hears\\nthe answer a long ways off, and tries to follow it, but I couldn\u2019t do\\nit, and directly I judged I\u2019d got into a nest of tow-heads, for I had\\nlittle dim glimpses of them on both sides of me\u2014sometimes just a narrow\\nchannel between, and some that I couldn\u2019t see I knowed was there\\nbecause I\u2019d hear the wash of the current against the old dead brush and\\ntrash that hung over the banks. Well, I warn\u2019t long loosing the whoops\\ndown amongst the tow-heads; and I only tried to chase them a little\\nwhile, anyway, because it was worse than chasing a Jack-o\u2019-lantern. You\\nnever knowed a sound dodge around so, and swap places so quick and so\\nmuch.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T10:30:00Z"}

{"order_number": 544, "name": "Chunk 544", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "I had to claw away from the bank pretty lively four or five times, to\\nkeep from knocking the islands out of the river; and so I judged the\\nraft must be butting into the bank every now and then, or else it would\\nget further ahead and clear out of hearing\u2014it was floating a little\\nfaster than what I was.", "chunk_order_number": 544, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:27Z"}

{"name": "islands", "description": "Landmasses in river", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "I had to claw away from the bank pretty lively four or five times, to\\nkeep from knocking the islands out of the river; and so I judged the\\nraft must be butting into the bank every now and then, or else it would\\nget further ahead and clear out of hearing\u2014it was floating a little\\nfaster than what I was.", "chunk_order_number": 544, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:27Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 545, "name": "Chunk 545", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "Well, I seemed to be in the open river again by-and-by, but I couldn\u2019t\\nhear no sign of a whoop nowheres. I reckoned Jim had fetched up on a\\nsnag, maybe, and it was all up with him. I was good and tired, so I\\nlaid down in the canoe and said I wouldn\u2019t bother no more. I didn\u2019t\\nwant to go to sleep, of course; but I was so sleepy I couldn\u2019t help it;\\nso I thought I would take jest one little cat-nap.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:27Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 546, "name": "Chunk 546", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "But I reckon it was more than a cat-nap, for when I waked up the stars\\nwas shining bright, the fog was all gone, and I was spinning down a big\\nbend stern first. {"chunk_order_number": 556, "name": "Chunk 556", "description": "Text content passage from Chapter XV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "\u201c_How?_ Why, hain\u2019t you been talking about my coming back, and all that\\nstuff, as if I\u2019d been gone away?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:28Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 557, "text": "\u201cHuck\u2014Huck Finn, you look me in de eye; look me in de eye. _Hain\u2019t_ you ben gone away?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 557", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "\u201cHuck\u2014Huck Finn, you look me in de eye; look me in de eye. _Hain\u2019t_ you\\nben gone away?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:28Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 565, "name": "Chunk 565", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, _de_ fog!\u2014de fog dat\u2019s been aroun\u2019 all night. En didn\u2019t I bust up agin a lot er dem islands en have\\na turrible time en mos\u2019 git drownded? Now ain\u2019 dat so, boss\u2014ain\u2019t it\\nso? You answer me dat.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:37:29Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 566, "name": "Chunk 566", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, this is too many for me, Jim. But this one was a staving dream; tell me all\\nabout it, Jim.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:30Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 574", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "So Jim went to work and told me the whole thing right through, just as\\nit happened, only he painted it up considerable. Then he said he must\\nstart in and \u201c\u2019terpret\u201d it, because it was sent for a warning. He said\\nthe first tow-head stood for a man that would try to do us some good,\\nbut the current was another man that would get us away from him. The\\nwhoops was warnings that would come to us every now and then, and if we\\ndidn\u2019t try hard to make out to understand them they\u2019d just take us into\\nbad luck, \u2019stead of keeping us out of it. The lot of tow-heads was\\ntroubles we was going to get into with quarrelsome people and all kinds\\nof mean folks, but if we minded our business and didn\u2019t talk back and\\naggravate them, we would pull through and get out of the fog and into\\nthe big clear river, which was the free States, and wouldn\u2019t have no\\nmore trouble.", "chunk_order_number": 574, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:30Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 579, "name": "Chunk 579", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat do dey stan\u2019 for? I\u2019se gwyne to tell you. When I got all wore out\\nwid work, en wid de callin\u2019 for you, en went to sleep, my heart wuz\\nmos\u2019 broke bekase you wuz los\u2019, en I didn\u2019 k\u2019yer no\u2019 mo\u2019 what become er\\nme en de raf\u2019. En when I wake up en fine you back agin, all safe en\\nsoun\u2019, de tears come, en I could a got down on my knees en kiss yo\u2019\\nfoot, I\u2019s so thankful. En all you wuz thinkin\u2019 \u2019bout wuz how you could\\nmake a fool uv ole Jim wid a lie. {"chunk_order_number": 581, "name": "Chunk 581", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "It was fifteen minutes before I could work myself up to go and humble\\nmyself to a nigger; but I done it, and I warn\u2019t ever sorry for it\\nafterwards, neither. I didn\u2019t do him no more mean tricks, and I\\nwouldn\u2019t done that one if I\u2019d a knowed it would make him feel that way.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T14:23:45Z"}

{"name": "regret", "description": "The narrator is exhibiting regret.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XV.", "chunk": "It was fifteen minutes before I could work myself up to go and humble\\nmyself to a nigger; but I done it, and I warn\u2019t ever sorry for it\\nafterwards, neither. I didn\u2019t do him no more mean tricks, and I\\nwouldn\u2019t done that one if I\u2019d a knowed it would make him feel that way.", "chunk_order_number": 581, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T14:23:45Z"}

{"name": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "We slept most all day, and started out at night, a little ways behind a\\nmonstrous long raft that was as long going by as a procession. She had\\nfour long sweeps at each end, so we judged she carried as many as\\nthirty men, likely. She had five big wigwams aboard, wide apart, and an\\nopen camp fire in the middle, and a tall flag-pole at each end. There\\nwas a power of style about her. It _amounted_ to something being a\\nraftsman on such a craft as that.", "chunk_order_number": 582, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:32Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 583, "text_content": "We went drifting down into a big bend, and the night clouded up and got hot. The river was very wide, and was walled with solid timber on both sides; you couldn\u2019t see a break in it hardly ever, or a light. We talked about Cairo, and wondered whether we would know it when we got to it. I said likely we wouldn\u2019t, because I had heard say there warn\u2019t but about a dozen houses there, and if they didn\u2019t happen to have them lit up, how was we going to know we was passing a town? Jim said if the two big rivers joined together there, that would show. But I said maybe we might think we was passing the foot of an island and coming into the same old river again. That disturbed Jim\u2014and me too. So the question was, what to do? I said, paddle ashore the first time a light showed, and tell them pap was behind, coming along with a trading-scow, and was a green hand at the business, and wanted to know how far it was to Cairo. {"order_number": 586, "name": "Chunk_586", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "But it warn\u2019t. It was Jack-o\u2019-lanterns, or lightning bugs; so he set\\ndown again, and went to watching, same as before. Jim said it made him\\nall over trembly and feverish to be so close to freedom. Well, I can\\ntell you it made me all over trembly and feverish, too, to hear him,\\nbecause I begun to get it through my head that he _was_ most free\u2014and\\nwho was to blame for it? Why, _me_. I couldn\u2019t get that out of my\\nconscience, no how nor no way. It got to troubling me so I couldn\u2019t\\nrest; I couldn\u2019t stay still in one place. It hadn\u2019t ever come home to\\nme before, what this thing was that I was doing. But now it did; and it\\nstayed with me, and scorched me more and more. I tried to make out to\\nmyself that _I_ warn\u2019t to blame, because _I_ didn\u2019t run Jim off from\\nhis rightful owner; but it warn\u2019t no use, conscience up and says, every\\ntime, \u201cBut you knowed he was running for his freedom, and you could a\\npaddled ashore and told somebody.\u201d That was so\u2014I couldn\u2019t get around\\nthat nowa...", "chunk_order_number": 586, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:32Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 587, "name": "Chunk 587", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XVI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "I got to feeling so mean and so miserable I most wished I was dead. I\\nfidgeted up and down the raft, abusing myself to myself, and Jim was\\nfidgeting up and down past me. We neither of us could keep still. Every\\ntime he danced around and says, \u201cDah\u2019s Cairo!\u201d it went through me like\\na shot, and I thought if it _was_ Cairo I reckoned I would die of\\nmiserableness.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:32Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 589, "text": "It most froze me to hear such talk. He wouldn\u2019t ever dared to talk such talk in his life before. It was according to the old saying, \u201cGive a nigger an inch and he\u2019ll take an ell.\u201d Thinks I, this is what comes of my not thinking. {"chunk_order_number": 619, "name": "Chunk 619", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell,\u201d says I, a-blubbering, \u201cI\u2019ve told everybody before, and they\\njust went away and left us.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T12:34:56Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 620, "name": "Chunk 620", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XVI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "\u201cPoor devil, there\u2019s something in that. We are right down sorry for\\nyou, but we\u2014well, hang it, we don\u2019t want the small-pox, you see. Look\\nhere, I\u2019ll tell you what to do. Don\u2019t you try to land by yourself, or\\nyou\u2019ll smash everything to pieces. You float along down about twenty\\nmiles, and you\u2019ll come to a town on the left-hand side of the river. It\\nwill be long after sun-up then, and when you ask for help you tell them\\nyour folks are all down with chills and fever. Don\u2019t be a fool again,\\nand let people guess what is the matter. Now we\u2019re trying to do you a\\nkindness; so you just put twenty miles between us, that\u2019s a good boy.\\nIt wouldn\u2019t do any good to land yonder where the light is\u2014it\u2019s only a\\nwood-yard. Say, I reckon your father\u2019s poor, and I\u2019m bound to say he\u2019s\\nin pretty hard luck. Here, I\u2019ll put a twenty-dollar gold piece on this\\nboard, and you get it when it floats by. I feel mighty mean to leave\\nyou; but my kingdom! it won\u2019t do to fool with small-pox, don\u2019t you\\nsee?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:36Z"}

{"name": "Text content", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "\u201cGood-bye, sir,\u201d says I; \u201cI won\u2019t let no runaway niggers get by me if I\\ncan help it.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 623, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:36Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 624, "content": "They went off and I got aboard the raft, feeling bad and low, because I\\nknowed very well I had done wrong, and I see it warn\u2019t no use for me to\\ntry to learn to do right; a body that don\u2019t get _started_ right when\\nhe\u2019s little ain\u2019t got no show\u2014when the pinch comes there ain\u2019t nothing\\nto back him up and keep him to his work, and so he gets beat. Then I\\nthought a minute, and says to myself, hold on; s\u2019pose you\u2019d a done\\nright and give Jim up, would you felt better than what you do now? No,\\nsays I, I\u2019d feel bad\u2014I\u2019d feel just the same way I do now. Well, then,\\nsays I, what\u2019s the use you learning to do right when it\u2019s troublesome\\nto do right and ain\u2019t no trouble to do wrong, and the wages is just the\\nsame? I was stuck. I couldn\u2019t answer that. So I reckoned I wouldn\u2019t\\nbother no more about it, but after this always do whichever come\\nhandiest at the time.", "name": "Chunk 624", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "They went off and I got aboard the raft, feeling bad and low, because I\\nknowed very well I had done wrong, and I see it warn\u2019t no use for me to\\ntry to learn to do right; a body that don\u2019t get _started_ right when\\nhe\u2019s little ain\u2019t got no show\u2014when the pinch comes there ain\u2019t nothing\\nto back him up and keep him to his work, and so he gets beat. Then I\\nthought a minute, and says to myself, hold on; s\u2019pose you\u2019d a done\\nright and give Jim up, would you felt better than what you do now? No,\\nsays I, I\u2019d feel bad\u2014I\u2019d feel just the same way I do now. Well, then,\\nsays I, what\u2019s the use you learning to do right when it\u2019s troublesome\\nto do right and ain\u2019t no trouble to do wrong, and the wages is just the\\nsame? I was stuck. I couldn\u2019t answer that. So I reckoned I wouldn\u2019t\\nbother no more about it, but after this always do whichever come\\nhandiest at the time.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:36Z"}

{"name": "morality", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "They went off and I got aboard the raft, feeling bad and low, because I\\nknowed very well I had done wrong, and I see it warn\u2019t no use for me to\\ntry to learn to do right; a body that don\u2019t get _started_ right when\\nhe\u2019s little ain\u2019t got no show\u2014when the pinch comes there ain\u2019t nothing\\nto back him up and keep him to his work, and so he gets beat. No,\\nsays I, I\u2019d feel bad\u2014I\u2019d feel just the same way I do now. {"chunk_order_number": 626, "text": "\u201cJim!\u201d", "name": "Chunk 626", "description": "A segment of text.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "\u201cJim!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:36Z"}

{"order_number": 629, "text": "\u201cI was a-listenin\u2019 to all de talk, en I slips into de river en was gwyne to shove for sho\u2019 if dey come aboard. {"name": "Chunk 631", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "Towards daybreak we tied up, and Jim was mighty particular about hiding\\nthe raft good. {"chunk_order_number": 634, "name": "Chunk 634", "description": "\\\\\"Mister, is that town Cairo?\\\\\"", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "\u201cMister, is that town Cairo?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:38Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 635, "content": "\u201cCairo? no. {"name": "Mister", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat town is it, mister?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 636, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:38Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 637, "text_content": "\u201cIf you want to know, go and find out. If you stay here botherin\u2019 around me for about a half a minute longer you\u2019ll get something you won\u2019t want.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 637", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "\u201cIf you want to know, go and find out. If you stay here botherin\u2019\\naround me for about a half a minute longer you\u2019ll get something you\\nwon\u2019t want.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:38Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 638, "name": "Chunk 638", "description": "I paddled to the raft. {"chunk_order_number": 639, "name": "Chunk 639", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "We passed another town before daylight, and I was going out again; but\\nit was high ground, so I didn\u2019t go. {"chunk_order_number": 646, "content": "We talked it all over. It wouldn\u2019t do to take to the shore; we couldn\u2019t\\ntake the raft up the stream, of course. There warn\u2019t no way but to wait\\nfor dark, and start back in the canoe and take the chances. So we slept\\nall day amongst the cottonwood thicket, so as to be fresh for the work,\\nand when we went back to the raft about dark the canoe was gone!", "name": "Chunk 646", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XVI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "We talked it all over. It wouldn\u2019t do to take to the shore; we couldn\u2019t\\ntake the raft up the stream, of course. There warn\u2019t no way but to wait\\nfor dark, and start back in the canoe and take the chances. So we slept\\nall day amongst the cottonwood thicket, so as to be fresh for the work,\\nand when we went back to the raft about dark the canoe was gone!", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:39Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 647, "name": "Chunk_647", "description": "We didn\u2019t say a word for a good while. There warn\u2019t anything to say. It would only look like we was finding fault, and that would be bound to fetch more bad luck\u2014and keep on fetching it, too, till we knowed enough to keep still.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "We didn\u2019t say a word for a good while. There warn\u2019t anything to say. We\\nboth knowed well enough it was some more work of the rattlesnake-skin;\\nso what was the use to talk about it? It would only look like we was\\nfinding fault, and that would be bound to fetch more bad luck\u2014and keep\\non fetching it, too, till we knowed enough to keep still.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:40Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 648, "text": "By-and-by we talked about what we better do, and found there warn\u2019t no\\nway but just to go along down with the raft till we got a chance to buy\\na canoe to go back in. We warn\u2019t going to borrow it when there warn\u2019t\\nanybody around, the way pap would do, for that might set people after\\nus.", "name": "Chunk 648", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "By-and-by we talked about what we better do, and found there warn\u2019t no\\nway but just to go along down with the raft till we got a chance to buy\\na canoe to go back in. We warn\u2019t going to borrow it when there warn\u2019t\\nanybody around, the way pap would do, for that might set people after\\nus.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:40Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 649, "name": "Chunk 649", "description": "Text passage from Chapter 16", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "So we shoved out after dark on the raft.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:40Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 650, "name": "Chunk 650", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "Anybody that don\u2019t believe yet that it\u2019s foolishness to handle a\\nsnake-skin, after all that that snake-skin done for us, will believe it\\nnow if they read on and see what more it done for us.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:40Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 651, "text": "The place to buy canoes is off of rafts laying up at shore. But we\\ndidn\u2019t see no rafts laying up; so we went along during three hours and\\nmore. Well, the night got gray and ruther thick, which is the next\\nmeanest thing to fog. You can\u2019t tell the shape of the river, and you\\ncan\u2019t see no distance. It got to be very late and still, and then along\\ncomes a steamboat up the river. We lit the lantern, and judged she\\nwould see it. Up-stream boats didn\u2019t generly come close to us; they go\\nout and follow the bars and hunt for easy water under the reefs; but\\nnights like this they bull right up the channel against the whole\\nriver.", "name": "Chunk_651", "description": "Text passage from Chapter 16", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "The place to buy canoes is off of rafts laying up at shore. {"order_number": 652, "name": "Chunk 652", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "We could hear her pounding along, but we didn\u2019t see her good till she\\nwas close. She aimed right for us. Often they do that and try to see\\nhow close they can come without touching; sometimes the wheel bites off\\na sweep, and then the pilot sticks his head out and laughs, and thinks\\nhe\u2019s mighty smart. Well, here she comes, and we said she was going to\\ntry and shave us; but she didn\u2019t seem to be sheering off a bit. She was\\na big one, and she was coming in a hurry, too, looking like a black\\ncloud with rows of glow-worms around it; but all of a sudden she bulged\\nout, big and scary, with a long row of wide-open furnace doors shining\\nlike red-hot teeth, and her monstrous bows and guards hanging right\\nover us. There was a yell at us, and a jingling of bells to stop the\\nengines, a powwow of cussing, and whistling of steam\u2014and as Jim went\\noverboard on one side and I on the other, she come smashing straight\\nthrough the raft.", "chunk_order_number": 652, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:40Z"}

There was a yell at us, and a jingling of bells to stop the\\nengines, a powwow of cussing, and whistling of steam\u2014and as Jim went\\noverboard on one side and I on the other, she come smashing straight\\nthrough the raft.", "chunk_order_number": 652, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:40Z"}

{"order_number": 653, "text": "I dived\u2014and I aimed to find the bottom, too, for a thirty-foot wheel had got to go over me, and I wanted it to have plenty of room. I could always stay under water a minute; this time I reckon I stayed under a minute and a half. Then I bounced for the top in a hurry, for I was nearly busting. I popped out to my armpits and blowed the water out of my nose, and puffed a bit. Of course there was a booming current; and of course that boat started her engines again ten seconds after she stopped them, for they never cared much for raftsmen; so now she was churning along up the river, out of sight in the thick weather, though I could hear her.", "name": "Chunk 653", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "I dived\u2014and I aimed to find the bottom, too, for a thirty-foot wheel\\nhad got to go over me, and I wanted it to have plenty of room. {"order_number": 654, "content": "I sung out for Jim about a dozen times, but I didn\u2019t get any answer; so\\nI grabbed a plank that touched me while I was \u201ctreading water,\u201d and\\nstruck out for shore, shoving it ahead of me. But I made out to see\\nthat the drift of the current was towards the left-hand shore, which\\nmeant that I was in a crossing; so I changed off and went that way.", "name": "Chunk 654", "description": "Text segment from chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "I sung out for Jim about a dozen times, but I didn\u2019t get any answer; so\\nI grabbed a plank that touched me while I was \u201ctreading water,\u201d and\\nstruck out for shore, shoving it ahead of me. But I made out to see\\nthat the drift of the current was towards the left-hand shore, which\\nmeant that I was in a crossing; so I changed off and went that way.", "chunk_order_number": 654, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:40Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 655, "name": "Chunk_655", "description": "It was one of these long, slanting, two-mile crossings; so I was a good long time in getting over. I made a safe landing, and clumb up the bank. I couldn\u2019t see but a little ways, but I went poking along over rough ground for a quarter of a mile or more, and then I run across a big old-fashioned double log-house before I noticed it. I was going to rush by and get away, but a lot of dogs jumped out and went to howling and barking at me, and I knowed better than to move another peg.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVI.", "chunk": "It was one of these long, slanting, two-mile crossings; so I was a good\\nlong time in getting over. {"text": "\\\"George Jackson, sir.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 661", "description": "Text chunk from chapter XVII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVII.", "chunk": "\u201cGeorge Jackson, sir.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 661, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T15:48:30Z"}

{"text": "\\\"What do you want?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 662", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XVII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVII.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat do you want?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 662, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:42Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 663, "content": "\\\"I don\u2019t want nothing, sir. I only want to go along by, but the dogs won\u2019t let me.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 663", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XVII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVII.", "chunk": "\u201cI don\u2019t want nothing, sir. I only want to go along by, but the dogs\\nwon\u2019t let me.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T14:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 664, "name": "Chunk 664", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVII.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat are you prowling around here this time of night for\u2014hey?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:42Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 665, "text": "\u201cI warn\u2019t prowling around, sir, I fell overboard off of the steamboat.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 665", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XVII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVII.", "chunk": "\u201cI warn\u2019t prowling around, sir, I fell overboard off of the steamboat.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T13:17:37Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 666, "text": "\u201cOh, you did, did you? Strike a light there, somebody. {"name": "Betsy", "description": "Character in the text", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVII.", "chunk": "\u201cSnatch that light away, Betsy, you old fool\u2014ain\u2019t you got any sense?\\nPut it on the floor behind the front door. {"chunk_order_number": 672, "name": "Chunk 672", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XVII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVII.", "chunk": "\u201cAll ready.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:43Z"}

Come slow; push the door open yourself\u2014just enough to\\nsqueeze in, d\u2019 you hear?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 675, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:37:43Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 676, "text": "I didn\u2019t hurry; I couldn\u2019t if I\u2019d a wanted to. I took one slow step at a time and there warn\u2019t a sound, only I thought I could hear my heart. The dogs were as still as the humans, but they followed a little behind me. When I got to the three log doorsteps I heard them unlocking and unbarring and unbolting. I put my hand on the door and pushed it a little and a little more till somebody said, \u201cThere, that\u2019s enough\u2014put your head in.\u201d I done it, but I judged they would take it off.", "name": "Chunk 676", "chapter": "CHAPTER XVII.", "chunk": "I didn\u2019t hurry; I couldn\u2019t if I\u2019d a wanted to.
