That\u2019s\\nonly in the summer time, when he comes there to take the sea baths.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:47Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1137, "text": "\\\"Why, you did.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1137", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, you did.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:48Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1138, "content": "\u201cI _didn\u2019t_ nuther.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1138", "description": "Text content passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cI _didn\u2019t_ nuther.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T14:59:28Z"}

{"order_number": 1139, "text": "\u201cYou did!\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1139", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cYou did!\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1139, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:48Z"}

{"order_number": 1140, "content": "\u201cI didn\u2019t.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1140", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cI didn\u2019t.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1140, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:48Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1141, "name": "Chunk 1141", "description": "\\\\\"You did.\\\\\"", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cYou did.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:48Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1142, "text": "\\\"I never said nothing of the kind.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1142", "description": "Text content passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cI never said nothing of the kind.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:38:48Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1143, "text": "\\\"Well, what _did_ you say, then?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1143", "description": "Text chunk from chapter XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, what _did_ you say, then?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:48Z"}

{"name": "Question", "description": "A question asked in the dialogue", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, what _did_ you say, then?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1143, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:48Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1144, "chunk": "\u201cSaid he come to take the sea _baths_\u2014that\u2019s what I said.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1144", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:38:48Z"}

{"type": "place", "name": "sea baths", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cSaid he come to take the sea _baths_\u2014that\u2019s what I said.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1144, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:38:48Z"}

{"text": "\u201cWell, then, how\u2019s he going to take the sea baths if it ain\u2019t on the sea?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1145, "name": "Chunk 1145", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, then, how\u2019s he going to take the sea baths if it ain\u2019t on the\\nsea?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:48Z"}

{"order_number": 1146, "text": "\\\"Looky here,\\\" I says; \\\"did you ever see any Congress-water?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1146", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cLooky here,\u201d I says; \u201cdid you ever see any Congress-water?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1146, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:49Z"}

{"order_number": 1147, "name": "Chunk 1147", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cYes.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1147, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:49Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1148, "text": "\u201cWell, did you have to go to Congress to get it?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1148", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, did you have to go to Congress to get it?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:49Z"}

{"order_number": 1149, "name": "Chunk 1149", "description": "Text chunk from chapter XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, no.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1149, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:49Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1150, "text": "\u201cWell, neither does William Fourth have to go to the sea to get a sea bath.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1150", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, neither does William Fourth have to go to the sea to get a sea\\nbath.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:49Z"}

{"text": "\u201cHow does he get it, then?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1151, "name": "Chunk 1151", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cHow does he get it, then?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:38:49Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1152, "content": "\\\"Gets it the way people down here gets Congress-water\u2014in barrels. There in the palace at Sheffield they\u2019ve got furnaces, and he wants his water hot. They can\u2019t bile that amount of water away off there at the sea. They haven\u2019t got no conveniences for it.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1152", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XXVI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cGets it the way people down here gets Congress-water\u2014in barrels. There\\nin the palace at Sheffield they\u2019ve got furnaces, and he wants his water\\nhot. They can\u2019t bile that amount of water away off there at the sea.\\nThey haven\u2019t got no conveniences for it.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:50Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1155, "text": "\u201cDo you go to church, too?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1155", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cDo you go to church, too?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T14:20:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1157, "text": "\\\"Where do you set?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1157", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhere do you set?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:50Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1158, "text": "\u201cWhy, in our pew.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1158", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, in our pew.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"order_number": 1159, "name": "Chunk 1159", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXVI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201c_Whose_ pew?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1159, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:50:30Z"}

{"order_number": 1160, "text": "\u201cWhy, _ourn_\u2014your Uncle Harvey\u2019s.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1160", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, _ourn_\u2014your Uncle Harvey\u2019s.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1160, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1162, "name": "Chunk 1162", "description": "\\\\\"Wants it to set in. What did you _reckon_ he wanted with it?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:51Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1163, "text": "\\\"Why, I thought he\u2019d be in the pulpit.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1163", "description": "Text segment from chapter XXVI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, I thought he\u2019d be in the pulpit.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T12:00:00Z"}

Then I says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:51Z"}

{"name": "thinking", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "Rot him, I forgot he was a preacher. I see I was up a stump again, so I\\nplayed another chicken bone and got another think. {"chunk_order_number": 1165, "text": "\u201cBlame it, do you suppose there ain\u2019t but one preacher to a church?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1165", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cBlame it, do you suppose there ain\u2019t but one preacher to a church?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-08T12:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1166, "content": "\\\"Why, what do they want with more?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1166", "description": "Text chunk", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, what do they want with more?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:52Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1167, "name": "Chunk 1167", "description": "\\\\\"What!\u2014to preach before a king? I never did see such a girl as you. {"chunk_order_number": 1188, "text": "\u201cWell, then, I\u2019ll believe some of it; but I hope to gracious if I\u2019ll believe the rest.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1188", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, then, I\u2019ll believe some of it; but I hope to gracious if I\u2019ll\\nbelieve the rest.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:53Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1189, "name": "Chunk 1189", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat is it you won\u2019t believe, Joe?\u201d says Mary Jane, stepping in with\\nSusan behind her. \u201cIt ain\u2019t right nor kind for you to talk so to him,\\nand him a stranger and so far from his people. How would you like to be\\ntreated so?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T14:37:00Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1201", "description": "Text segment from chapter XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "So then I lit out\u2014for bed, I said, meaning some time or another. When I\\ngot by myself I went to thinking the thing over. I says to myself,\\nshall I go to that doctor, private, and blow on these frauds? No\u2014that\\nwon\u2019t do. He might tell who told him; then the king and the duke would\\nmake it warm for me. Shall I go, private, and tell Mary Jane? No\u2014I\\ndasn\u2019t do it. Her face would give them a hint, sure; they\u2019ve got the\\nmoney, and they\u2019d slide right out and get away with it. If she was to\\nfetch in help I\u2019d get mixed up in the business before it was done with,\\nI judge. No; there ain\u2019t no good way but one. I got to steal that\\nmoney, somehow; and I got to steal it some way that they won\u2019t\\nsuspicion that I done it. They\u2019ve got a good thing here, and they ain\u2019t\\na-going to leave till they\u2019ve played this family and this town for all\\nthey\u2019re worth, so I\u2019ll find a chance time enough. {"chunk_order_number": 1202, "name": "Chunk 1202", "description": "Text passage from Chapter 26", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "So, thinks I, I\u2019ll go and search them rooms. Upstairs the hall was\\ndark, but I found the duke\u2019s room, and started to paw around it with my\\nhands; but I recollected it wouldn\u2019t be much like the king to let\\nanybody else take care of that money but his own self; so then I went\\nto his room and begun to paw around there. But I see I couldn\u2019t do\\nnothing without a candle, and I dasn\u2019t light one, of course. So I\\njudged I\u2019d got to do the other thing\u2014lay for them and eavesdrop. About\\nthat time I hears their footsteps coming, and was going to skip under\\nthe bed; I reached for it, but it wasn\u2019t where I thought it would be;\\nbut I touched the curtain that hid Mary Jane\u2019s frocks, so I jumped in\\nbehind that and snuggled in amongst the gowns, and stood there\\nperfectly still.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:55Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1209, "name": "Chunk 1209", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat! And not sell out the rest o\u2019 the property? {"chunk_order_number": 1210, "text": "The duke he grumbled; said the bag of gold was enough, and he didn\u2019t\\nwant to go no deeper\u2014didn\u2019t want to rob a lot of orphans of\\n_everything_ they had.", "name": "Chunk 1210", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXVI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "The duke he grumbled; said the bag of gold was enough, and he didn\u2019t\\nwant to go no deeper\u2014didn\u2019t want to rob a lot of orphans of\\n_everything_ they had.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T00:00:00Z"}

{"name": "orphans", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, how you talk!\u201d says the king. \u201cWe sha\u2019n\u2019t rob \u2019em of nothing at\\nall but jest this money. The people that _buys_ the property is the\\nsuff\u2019rers; because as soon \u2019s it\u2019s found out \u2019at we didn\u2019t own it\u2014which\\nwon\u2019t be long after we\u2019ve slid\u2014the sale won\u2019t be valid, and it\u2019ll all\\ngo back to the estate. These yer orphans \u2019ll git their house back agin,\\nand that\u2019s enough for _them;_ they\u2019re young and spry, and k\u2019n easy earn\\na livin\u2019. _They_ ain\u2019t a-goin to suffer. Why, jest think\u2014there\u2019s\\nthous\u2019n\u2019s and thous\u2019n\u2019s that ain\u2019t nigh so well off. Bless you, _they_\\nain\u2019t got noth\u2019n\u2019 to complain of.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1211, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"chunk_order_number": 1218, "text": "\u201cBecause Mary Jane \u2019ll be in mourning from this out; and first you know\\nthe nigger that does up the rooms will get an order to box these duds\\nup and put \u2019em away; and do you reckon a nigger can run across money\\nand not borrow some of it?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1218", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cBecause Mary Jane \u2019ll be in mourning from this out; and first you know\\nthe nigger that does up the rooms will get an order to box these duds\\nup and put \u2019em away; and do you reckon a nigger can run across money\\nand not borrow some of it?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:57Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1219, "name": "Chunk 1219", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXVI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVI.", "chunk": "\u201cYour head\u2019s level agin, duke,\u201d says the king; and he comes a-fumbling\\nunder the curtain two or three foot from where I was. I stuck tight to\\nthe wall and kept mighty still, though quivery; and I wondered what\\nthem fellows would say to me if they catched me; and I tried to think\\nwhat I\u2019d better do if they did catch me. But the king he got the bag\\nbefore I could think more than about a half a thought, and he never\\nsuspicioned I was around. They took and shoved the bag through a rip in\\nthe straw tick that was under the feather-bed, and crammed it in a foot\\nor two amongst the straw and said it was all right now, because a\\nnigger only makes up the feather-bed, and don\u2019t turn over the straw\\ntick only about twice a year, and so it warn\u2019t in no danger of getting\\nstole now.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:57Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1220, "text": "But I knowed better. I had it out of there before they was half-way\\ndown stairs. I groped along up to my cubby, and hid it there till I\\ncould get a chance to do better. I judged I better hide it outside of\\nthe house somewheres, because if they missed it they would give the\\nhouse a good ransacking: I knowed that very well. Then I turned in,\\nwith my clothes all on; but I couldn\u2019t a gone to sleep if I\u2019d a wanted\\nto, I was in such a sweat to get through with the business. {"name": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "I crept to their doors and listened; they was snoring. So I tiptoed\\nalong, and got down stairs all right. There warn\u2019t a sound anywheres. I\\npeeped through a crack of the dining-room door, and see the men that\\nwas watching the corpse all sound asleep on their chairs. The door was\\nopen into the parlor, where the corpse was laying, and there was a\\ncandle in both rooms. I passed along, and the parlor door was open; but\\nI see there warn\u2019t nobody in there but the remainders of Peter; so I\\nshoved on by; but the front door was locked, and the key wasn\u2019t there.\\nJust then I heard somebody coming down the stairs, back behind me. I\\nrun in the parlor and took a swift look around, and the only place I\\nsee to hide the bag was in the coffin. The lid was shoved along about a\\nfoot, showing the dead man\u2019s face down in there, with a wet cloth over\\nit, and his shroud on. I tucked the money-bag in under the lid, just\\ndown beyond where his hands was crossed, which made me creep, they was\\nso ...", "chunk_order_number": 1222, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:57Z"}

{"order_number": 1223, "name": "Chunk 1223", "description": "The text chunk", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "The person coming was Mary Jane. She went to the coffin, very soft, and\\nkneeled down and looked in; then she put up her handkerchief, and I see\\nshe begun to cry, though I couldn\u2019t hear her, and her back was to me. I\\nslid out, and as I passed the dining-room I thought I\u2019d make sure them\\nwatchers hadn\u2019t seen me; so I looked through the crack, and everything\\nwas all right. They hadn\u2019t stirred.", "chunk_order_number": 1223, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:57Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1224", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "I slipped up to bed, feeling ruther blue, on accounts of the thing\\nplaying out that way after I had took so much trouble and run so much\\nresk about it. Says I, if it could stay where it is, all right; because\\nwhen we get down the river a hundred mile or two I could write back to\\nMary Jane, and she could dig him up again and get it; but that ain\u2019t\\nthe thing that\u2019s going to happen; the thing that\u2019s going to happen is,\\nthe money \u2019ll be found when they come to screw on the lid. Then the\\nking \u2019ll get it again, and it \u2019ll be a long day before he gives anybody\\nanother chance to smouch it from him. Of course I _wanted_ to slide\\ndown and get it out of there, but I dasn\u2019t try it. Every minute it was\\ngetting earlier now, and pretty soon some of them watchers would begin\\nto stir, and I might get catched\u2014catched with six thousand dollars in\\nmy hands that nobody hadn\u2019t hired me to take care of. I don\u2019t wish to\\nbe mixed up in no such business as that, I says to myself.", "chunk_order_number": 1224, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"chunk_order_number": 1225, "name": "Chunk 1225", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "When I got down stairs in the morning the parlor was shut up, and the\\nwatchers was gone. {"chunk_order_number": 1226, "name": "Chunk 1226", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XXVII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "Towards the middle of the day the undertaker come with his man, and\\nthey set the coffin in the middle of the room on a couple of chairs,\\nand then set all our chairs in rows, and borrowed more from the\\nneighbors till the hall and the parlor and the dining-room was full. I\\nsee the coffin lid was the way it was before, but I dasn\u2019t go to look\\nin under it, with folks around.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-07-26T14:10:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1227, "name": "Chunk 1227", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "Then the people begun to flock in, and the beats and the girls took\\nseats in the front row at the head of the coffin, and for a half an\\nhour the people filed around slow, in single rank, and looked down at\\nthe dead man\u2019s face a minute, and some dropped in a tear, and it was\\nall very still and solemn, only the girls and the beats holding\\nhandkerchiefs to their eyes and keeping their heads bent, and sobbing a\\nlittle. There warn\u2019t no other sound but the scraping of the feet on the\\nfloor and blowing noses\u2014because people always blows them more at a\\nfuneral than they do at other places except church.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T13:46:29Z"}

There warn\u2019t no other sound but the scraping of the feet on the\\nfloor and blowing noses\u2014because people always blows them more at a\\nfuneral than they do at other places except church.", "chunk_order_number": 1227, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T13:46:29Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1228", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "When the place was packed full the undertaker he slid around in his\\nblack gloves with his softy soothering ways, putting on the last\\ntouches, and getting people and things all ship-shape and comfortable,\\nand making no more sound than a cat. He never spoke; he moved people\\naround, he squeezed in late ones, he opened up passageways, and done it\\nwith nods, and signs with his hands. Then he took his place over\\nagainst the wall. He was the softest, glidingest, stealthiest man I\\never see; and there warn\u2019t no more smile to him than there is to a ham.", "chunk_order_number": 1228, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:58Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1229, "name": "Chunk 1229", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXVII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "They had borrowed a melodeum\u2014a sick one; and when everything was ready\\na young woman set down and worked it, and it was pretty skreeky and\\ncolicky, and everybody joined in and sung, and Peter was the only one\\nthat had a good thing, according to my notion. Then the Reverend Hobson\\nopened up, slow and solemn, and begun to talk; and straight off the\\nmost outrageous row busted out in the cellar a body ever heard; it was\\nonly one dog, but he made a most powerful racket, and he kept it up\\nright along; the parson he had to stand there, over the coffin, and\\nwait\u2014you couldn\u2019t hear yourself think. It was right down awkward, and\\nnobody didn\u2019t seem to know what to do. {"chunk_order_number": 1230, "name": "Chunk 1230", "description": "Text segment from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "Well, the funeral sermon was very good, but pison long and tiresome;\\nand then the king he shoved in and got off some of his usual rubbage,\\nand at last the job was through, and the undertaker begun to sneak up\\non the coffin with his screw-driver. I was in a sweat then, and watched\\nhim pretty keen. But he never meddled at all; just slid the lid along\\nas soft as mush, and screwed it down tight and fast. So there I was! I\\ndidn\u2019t know whether the money was in there or not. So, says I, s\u2019pose\\nsomebody has hogged that bag on the sly?\u2014now how do _I_ know whether to\\nwrite to Mary Jane or not? S\u2019pose she dug him up and didn\u2019t find\\nnothing, what would she think of me? Blame it, I says, I might get\\nhunted up and jailed; I\u2019d better lay low and keep dark, and not write\\nat all; the thing\u2019s awful mixed now; trying to better it, I\u2019ve worsened\\nit a hundred times, and I wish to goodness I\u2019d just let it alone, dad\\nfetch the whole business!", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:58Z"}

{"name": "the girls", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "The king he visited around in the evening, and sweetened everybody up,\\nand made himself ever so friendly; and he give out the idea that his\\ncongregation over in England would be in a sweat about him, so he must\\nhurry and settle up the estate right away and leave for home. He was\\nvery sorry he was so pushed, and so was everybody; they wished he could\\nstay longer, but they said they could see it couldn\u2019t be done. And he\\nsaid of course him and William would take the girls home with them; and\\nthat pleased everybody too, because then the girls would be well fixed\\nand amongst their own relations; and it pleased the girls, too\u2014tickled\\nthem so they clean forgot they ever had a trouble in the world; and\\ntold him to sell out as quick as he wanted to, they would be ready.\\nThem poor things was that glad and happy it made my heart ache to see\\nthem getting fooled and lied to so, but I didn\u2019t see no safe way for me\\nto chip in and change the general tune.", "chunk_order_number": 1232, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:58Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1233, "name": "Chunk 1233", "description": "Well, blamed if the king didn\u2019t bill the house and the niggers and all the property for auction straight off\u2014sale two days after the funeral; but anybody could buy private beforehand if they wanted to.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "Well, blamed if the king didn\u2019t bill the house and the niggers and all\\nthe property for auction straight off\u2014sale two days after the funeral;\\nbut anybody could buy private beforehand if they wanted to.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:38:58Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1234, "name": "So the next day after the funeral, along about noon-time, the girls\u2019\\njoy got the first jolt. A couple of nigger traders come along, and the\\nking sold them the niggers reasonable, for three-day drafts as they\\ncalled it, and away they went, the two sons up the river to Memphis,\\nand their mother down the river to Orleans. I thought them poor girls\\nand them niggers would break their hearts for grief; they cried around\\neach other, and took on so it most made me down sick to see it. The\\ngirls said they hadn\u2019t ever dreamed of seeing the family separated or\\nsold away from the town. I can\u2019t ever get it out of my memory, the\\nsight of them poor miserable girls and niggers hanging around each\\nother\u2019s necks and crying; and I reckon I couldn\u2019t a stood it all, but\\nwould a had to bust out and tell on our gang if I hadn\u2019t knowed the\\nsale warn\u2019t no account and the niggers would be back home in a week or\\ntwo.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "So the next day after the funeral, along about noon-time, the girls\u2019\\njoy got the first jolt. The\\ngirls said they hadn\u2019t ever dreamed of seeing the family separated or\\nsold away from the town. I can\u2019t ever get it out of my memory, the\\nsight of them poor miserable girls and niggers hanging around each\\nother\u2019s necks and crying; and I reckon I couldn\u2019t a stood it all, but\\nwould a had to bust out and tell on our gang if I hadn\u2019t knowed the\\nsale warn\u2019t no account and the niggers would be back home in a week or\\ntwo.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T16:38:59Z"}

A couple of nigger traders come along, and the\\nking sold them the niggers reasonable, for three-day drafts as they\\ncalled it, and away they went, the two sons up the river to Memphis,\\nand their mother down the river to Orleans. I thought them poor girls\\nand them niggers would break their hearts for grief; they cried around\\neach other, and took on so it most made me down sick to see it. The\\ngirls said they hadn\u2019t ever dreamed of seeing the family separated or\\nsold away from the town. {"chunk_order_number": 1257, "text": "\u201cIt does beat all how neat the niggers played their hand. They let on\\nto be _sorry_ they was going out of this region! {"chunk_order_number": 1269, "content": "\u201cWell, _they\u2019d_ be in this house yet and we _wouldn\u2019t_ if I could a got\\nmy advice listened to.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1269", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, _they\u2019d_ be in this house yet and we _wouldn\u2019t_ if I could a got\\nmy advice listened to.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:03Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1270, "name": "Chunk 1270", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVII.", "chunk": "The king sassed back as much as was safe for him, and then swapped\\naround and lit into _me_ again. He give me down the banks for not\\ncoming and _telling_ him I see the niggers come out of his room acting\\nthat way\u2014said any fool would a _knowed_ something was up. And then\\nwaltzed in and cussed _himself_ awhile, and said it all come of him not\\nlaying late and taking his natural rest that morning, and he\u2019d be\\nblamed if he\u2019d ever do it again. So they went off a-jawing; and I felt\\ndreadful glad I\u2019d worked it all off on to the niggers, and yet hadn\u2019t\\ndone the niggers no harm by it.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"name": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "By-and-by it was getting-up time. So I come down the ladder and started\\nfor down-stairs; but as I come to the girls\u2019 room the door was open,\\nand I see Mary Jane setting by her old hair trunk, which was open and\\nshe\u2019d been packing things in it\u2014getting ready to go to England. But she\\nhad stopped now with a folded gown in her lap, and had her face in her\\nhands, crying. I felt awful bad to see it; of course anybody would. {"chunk_order_number": 1274, "name": "Chunk 1274", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cOh, dear, dear, to think they ain\u2019t _ever_ going to see each other any\\nmore!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:04Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1275", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cBut they _will_\u2014and inside of two weeks\u2014and I _know_ it!\u201d says I.", "chunk_order_number": 1275, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:04Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1277, "name": "Chunk 1277", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "I see I had spoke too sudden and said too much, and was in a close\\nplace. I asked her to let me think a minute; and she set there, very\\nimpatient and excited and handsome, but looking kind of happy and\\neased-up, like a person that\u2019s had a tooth pulled out. So I went to\\nstudying it out. I says to myself, I reckon a body that ups and tells\\nthe truth when he is in a tight place is taking considerable many\\nresks, though I ain\u2019t had no experience, and can\u2019t say for certain; but\\nit looks so to me, anyway; and yet here\u2019s a case where I\u2019m blest if it\\ndon\u2019t look to me like the truth is better and actuly _safer_ than a\\nlie. I must lay it by in my mind, and think it over some time or other,\\nit\u2019s so kind of strange and unregular. I never see nothing like it.\\nWell, I says to myself at last, I\u2019m a-going to chance it; I\u2019ll up and\\ntell the truth this time, though it does seem most like setting down on\\na kag of powder and touching it off just to see where you\u2019ll go to.\\nThen I says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:04Z"}

{"order_number": 1278, "text": "\u201cMiss Mary Jane, is there any place out of town a little ways where you could go and stay three or four days?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1278", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cMiss Mary Jane, is there any place out of town a little ways where you\\ncould go and stay three or four days?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1278, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1281", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cFour days!\u201d she says; \u201cI\u2019ll stay a year!\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1281, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"chunk_order_number": 1282, "name": "Chunk 1282", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXVIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cAll right,\u201d I says, \u201cI don\u2019t want nothing more out of _you_ than just\\nyour word\u2014I druther have it than another man\u2019s kiss-the-Bible.\u201d She\\nsmiled and reddened up very sweet, and I says, \u201cIf you don\u2019t mind it,\\nI\u2019ll shut the door\u2014and bolt it.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:05Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1283, "text": "Then I come back and set down again, and says:", "name": "Chunk 1283", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "Then I come back and set down again, and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-04-26T14:10:00Z"}

{"text": "\u201cDon\u2019t you holler. Just set still and take it like a man. I got to tell\\nthe truth, and you want to brace up, Miss Mary, because it\u2019s a bad\\nkind, and going to be hard to take, but there ain\u2019t no help for it.\\nThese uncles of yourn ain\u2019t no uncles at all; they\u2019re a couple of\\nfrauds\u2014regular dead-beats. {"chunk_order_number": 1285, "name": "Chunk 1285", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "It jolted her up like everything, of course; but I was over the shoal\\nwater now, so I went right along, her eyes a-blazing higher and higher\\nall the time, and told her every blame thing, from where we first\\nstruck that young fool going up to the steamboat, clear through to\\nwhere she flung herself on to the king\u2019s breast at the front door and\\nhe kissed her sixteen or seventeen times\u2014and then up she jumps, with\\nher face afire like sunset, and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:05Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1289, "name": "Chunk 1289", "description": "\u201cOh,\u201d she says, \u201cwhat am I _thinking_ about!\u201d she says, and set right\\ndown again. \u201cDon\u2019t mind what I said\u2014please don\u2019t\u2014you _won\u2019t,_ now,\\n_will_ you?\u201d Laying her silky hand on mine in that kind of a way that I\\nsaid I would die first. \u201cI never thought, I was so stirred up,\u201d she\\nsays; \u201cnow go on, and I won\u2019t do so any more. {"chunk_order_number": 1290, "name": "Chunk 1290", "description": "\u201cWell,\u201d I says, \u201cit\u2019s a rough gang, them two frauds, and I\u2019m fixed so I\\ngot to travel with them a while longer, whether I want to or not\u2014I\\ndruther not tell you why; and if you was to blow on them this town\\nwould get me out of their claws, and _I_\u2019d be all right; but there\u2019d be\\nanother person that you don\u2019t know about who\u2019d be in big trouble. Well,\\nwe got to save _him_, hain\u2019t we? Of course. {"chunk_order_number": 1293, "text": "\u201cA little short of four miles\u2014right out in the country, back here.\u201d", "name": "Chunk_1293", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cA little short of four miles\u2014right out in the country, back here.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T15:10:20Z"}

{"order_number": 1294, "text": "\\\"Well, that\u2019ll answer. Now you go along out there, and lay low till nine or half-past to-night, and then get them to fetch you home again\u2014tell them you\u2019ve thought of something. If you get here before eleven put a candle in this window, and if I don\u2019t turn up wait _till_ eleven, and _then_ if I don\u2019t turn up it means I\u2019m gone, and out of the way, and safe. Then you come out and spread the news around, and get these beats jailed.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1294", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, that\u2019ll answer. Now you go along out there, and lay low till\\nnine or half-past to-night, and then get them to fetch you home\\nagain\u2014tell them you\u2019ve thought of something. {"chunk_order_number": 1296, "name": "Chunk 1296", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cAnd if it just happens so that I don\u2019t get away, but get took up along\\nwith them, you must up and say I told you the whole thing beforehand,\\nand you must stand by me all you can.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T12:34:56Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1306", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, it\u2019s because you ain\u2019t one of these leather-face people. I don\u2019t\\nwant no better book than what your face is. {"chunk_order_number": 1308, "name": "Chunk 1308", "description": "\u201cYes; never mind about them. They\u2019ve got to stand it yet a while. They\\nmight suspicion something if all of you was to go. {"chunk_order_number": 1310, "name": "Chunk 1310", "description": "Text chunk", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, then, it sha\u2019n\u2019t be.\u201d It was well enough to tell _her_ so\u2014no\\nharm in it. {"chunk_order_number": 1314, "text": "\u201cI wish I knowed, but I don\u2019t. {"order_number": 1317, "text": "\u201cI\u2019d ruther not _tell_ you where I put it, Miss Mary Jane, if you don\u2019t mind letting me off; but I\u2019ll write it for you on a piece of paper, and you can read it along the road to Mr. Lothrop\u2019s, if you want to. {"chunk_order_number": 1319, "text": "So I wrote: \u201cI put it in the coffin. It was in there when you was crying there, away in the night. {"chunk_order_number": 1320, "content": "It made my eyes water a little to remember her crying there all by herself in the night, and them devils laying there right under her own roof, shaming her and robbing her; and when I folded it up and give it to her I see the water come into her eyes, too; and she shook me by the hand, hard, and says:", "name": "Chunk 1320", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "It made my eyes water a little to remember her crying there all by\\nherself in the night, and them devils laying there right under her own\\nroof, shaming her and robbing her; and when I folded it up and give it\\nto her I see the water come into her eyes, too; and she shook me by the\\nhand, hard, and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:10Z"}

I\u2019m going to do everything just as you\u2019ve told me; and if\\nI don\u2019t ever see you again, I sha\u2019n\u2019t ever forget you and I\u2019ll think of\\nyou a many and a many a time, and I\u2019ll _pray_ for you, too!\u201d\u2014and she\\nwas gone.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:10Z"}

I\u2019m going to do everything just as you\u2019ve told me; and if\\nI don\u2019t ever see you again, I sha\u2019n\u2019t ever forget you and I\u2019ll think of\\nyou a many and a many a time, and I\u2019ll _pray_ for you, too!\u201d\u2014and she\\nwas gone.", "chunk_order_number": 1321, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:10Z"}

{"order_number": 1322, "name": "Chunk 1322", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXVIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "Pray for me! I reckoned if she knowed me she\u2019d take a job that was more\\nnearer her size. But I bet she done it, just the same\u2014she was just that\\nkind. She had the grit to pray for Judus if she took the notion\u2014there\\nwarn\u2019t no back-down to her, I judge. You may say what you want to, but\\nin my opinion she had more sand in her than any girl I ever see; in my\\nopinion she was just full of sand. It sounds like flattery, but it\\nain\u2019t no flattery. And when it comes to beauty\u2014and goodness, too\u2014she\\nlays over them all. I hain\u2019t ever seen her since that time that I see\\nher go out of that door; no, I hain\u2019t ever seen her since, but I reckon\\nI\u2019ve thought of her a many and a many a million times, and of her\\nsaying she would pray for me; and if ever I\u2019d a thought it would do any\\ngood for me to pray for _her_, blamed if I wouldn\u2019t a done it or bust.", "chunk_order_number": 1322, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:10Z"}

{"name": "praying", "description": "The act of praying", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "Pray for me! I reckoned if she knowed me she\u2019d take a job that was more\\nnearer her size. You may say what you want to, but\\nin my opinion she had more sand in her than any girl I ever see; in my\\nopinion she was just full of sand. It sounds like flattery, but it\\nain\u2019t no flattery. And when it comes to beauty\u2014and goodness, too\u2014she\\nlays over them all. I hain\u2019t ever seen her since that time that I see\\nher go out of that door; no, I hain\u2019t ever seen her since, but I reckon\\nI\u2019ve thought of her a many and a many a million times, and of her\\nsaying she would pray for me; and if ever I\u2019d a thought it would do any\\ngood for me to pray for _her_, blamed if I wouldn\u2019t a done it or bust.", "chunk_order_number": 1322, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:10Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1347, "name": "Chunk 1347", "description": "Text passage from chapter XXVIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, ther\u2019 ain\u2019t no sense in it. A body might stump his toe, and take\\npison, and fall down the well, and break his neck, and bust his brains\\nout, and somebody come along and ask what killed him, and some numskull\\nup and say, \u2018Why, he stumped his _toe_.\u2019 Would ther\u2019 be any sense in\\nthat? _No_. And ther\u2019 ain\u2019t no sense in _this_, nuther. Is it\\nketching?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T14:39:13Z"}

{"order_number": 1348, "text": "\u201cIs it _ketching?_ Why, how you talk. Is a _harrow_ catching\u2014in the\\ndark? If you don\u2019t hitch on to one tooth, you\u2019re bound to on another,\\nain\u2019t you? And you can\u2019t get away with that tooth without fetching the\\nwhole harrow along, can you? Well, these kind of mumps is a kind of a\\nharrow, as you may say\u2014and it ain\u2019t no slouch of a harrow, nuther, you\\ncome to get it hitched on good.\u201d", "name": "Chunk_1348", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cIs it _ketching?_ Why, how you talk. Is a _harrow_ catching\u2014in the\\ndark? If you don\u2019t hitch on to one tooth, you\u2019re bound to on another,\\nain\u2019t you? And you can\u2019t get away with that tooth without fetching the\\nwhole harrow along, can you? Well, these kind of mumps is a kind of a\\nharrow, as you may say\u2014and it ain\u2019t no slouch of a harrow, nuther, you\\ncome to get it hitched on good.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1348, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"order_number": 1351, "text": "\u201cWell, why wouldn\u2019t you?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1351", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, why wouldn\u2019t you?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1351, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:13Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1352, "name": "Chunk 1352", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cJust look at it a minute, and maybe you can see. Hain\u2019t your uncles\\nobleegd to get along home to England as fast as they can? And do you\\nreckon they\u2019d be mean enough to go off and leave you to go all that\\njourney by yourselves? _You_ know they\u2019ll wait for you. So fur, so\\ngood. Your uncle Harvey\u2019s a preacher, ain\u2019t he? Very well, then; is a\\n_preacher_ going to deceive a steamboat clerk? is he going to deceive a\\n_ship clerk?_\u2014so as to get them to let Miss Mary Jane go aboard? Now\\n_you_ know he ain\u2019t. What _will_ he do, then? Why, he\u2019ll say, \u2018It\u2019s a\\ngreat pity, but my church matters has got to get along the best way\\nthey can; for my niece has been exposed to the dreadful pluribus-unum\\nmumps, and so it\u2019s my bounden duty to set down here and wait the three\\nmonths it takes to show on her if she\u2019s got it.\u2019 But never mind, if you\\nthink it\u2019s best to tell your uncle Harvey\u2014\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:13Z"}

{"order_number": 1353, "name": "Chunk 1353", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cShucks, and stay fooling around here when we could all be having good\\ntimes in England whilst we was waiting to find out whether Mary Jane\u2019s\\ngot it or not? {"name": "Chunk 1354", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, anyway, maybe you\u2019d better tell some of the neighbors.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1354, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:14Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1355, "text_content": "\u201cListen at that, now. You do beat all for natural stupidness. Can\u2019t you\\n_see_ that _they\u2019d_ go and tell? {"chunk_order_number": 1360, "name": "Chunk 1360", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXVIII.", "chunk": "\u201cOf course; bother them kind of names, a body can\u2019t ever seem to\\nremember them, half the time, somehow. Yes, she said, say she has run\\nover for to ask the Apthorps to be sure and come to the auction and buy\\nthis house, because she allowed her uncle Peter would ruther they had\\nit than anybody else; and she\u2019s going to stick to them till they say\\nthey\u2019ll come, and then, if she ain\u2019t too tired, she\u2019s coming home; and\\nif she is, she\u2019ll be home in the morning anyway. {"name": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "description": "Chapter of ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "They was fetching a very nice-looking old gentleman along, and a\\nnice-looking younger one, with his right arm in a sling. I reckoned they\u2019d turn pale. But no, nary a pale did _they_\\nturn. The duke he never let on he suspicioned what was up, but just\\nwent a goo-gooing around, happy and satisfied, like a jug that\u2019s\\ngoogling out buttermilk; and as for the king, he just gazed and gazed\\ndown sorrowful on them new-comers like it give him the stomach-ache in\\nhis very heart to think there could be such frauds and rascals in the\\nworld. {"name": "Chunk 1367", "description": "\u201cThis is a surprise to me which I wasn\u2019t looking for; and I\u2019ll\\nacknowledge, candid and frank, I ain\u2019t very well fixed to meet it and\\nanswer it; for my brother and me has had misfortunes; he\u2019s broke his\\narm, and our baggage got put off at a town above here last night in the\\nnight by a mistake. I am Peter Wilks\u2019 brother Harvey, and this is his\\nbrother William, which can\u2019t hear nor speak\u2014and can\u2019t even make signs\\nto amount to much, now\u2019t he\u2019s only got one hand to work them with. We\\nare who we say we are; and in a day or two, when I get the baggage, I\\ncan prove it. But up till then I won\u2019t say nothing more, but go to the\\nhotel and wait.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1367, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-08T12:00:00Z"}

{"order_number": 1371, "name": "Chunk 1371", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXIX", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cSay, looky here; if you are Harvey Wilks, when\u2019d you come to this\\ntown?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1371, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-07-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1376, "name": "Chunk 1376", "description": "Text content passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cI come down on the Susan Powell from Cincinnati.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1377, "text": "\u201cWell, then, how\u2019d you come to be up at the Pint in the _mornin_\u2019\u2014in a canoe?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1377", "description": "Text chunk from chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, then, how\u2019d you come to be up at the Pint in the _mornin_\u2019\u2014in a\\ncanoe?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-15T12:00:00Z"}

{"order_number": 1386, "name": "Chunk_1386", "description": "Text passage from chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cNeighbors, I don\u2019t know whether the new couple is frauds or not; but\\nif _these_ two ain\u2019t frauds, I am an idiot, that\u2019s all. I think it\u2019s\\nour duty to see that they don\u2019t get away from here till we\u2019ve looked\\ninto this thing. Come along, Hines; come along, the rest of you. We\u2019ll\\ntake these fellows to the tavern and affront them with t\u2019other couple,\\nand I reckon we\u2019ll find out _something_ before we get through.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1386, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:17Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1389, "name": "Chunk 1389", "description": "Text passage.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cI don\u2019t wish to be too hard on these two men, but _I_ think they\u2019re\\nfrauds, and they may have complices that we don\u2019t know nothing about.\\nIf they have, won\u2019t the complices get away with that bag of gold Peter\\nWilks left? It ain\u2019t unlikely. If these men ain\u2019t frauds, they won\u2019t\\nobject to sending for that money and letting us keep it till they prove\\nthey\u2019re all right\u2014ain\u2019t that so?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:39:18Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1392, "name": "Chunk 1392", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cWhere is it, then?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:18Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1393, "name": "Chunk 1393", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXIX", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, when my niece give it to me to keep for her I took and hid it\\ninside o\u2019 the straw tick o\u2019 my bed, not wishin\u2019 to bank it for the few\\ndays we\u2019d be here, and considerin\u2019 the bed a safe place, we not bein\u2019\\nused to niggers, and suppos\u2019n\u2019 \u2019em honest, like servants in England.\\nThe niggers stole it the very next mornin\u2019 after I had went down\\nstairs; and when I sold \u2019em I hadn\u2019t missed the money yit, so they got\\nclean away with it. My servant here k\u2019n tell you \u2019bout it, gentlemen.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:18Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1397, "name": "Chunk 1397", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "Well, then they sailed in on the general investigation, and there we\\nhad it, up and down, hour in, hour out, and nobody never said a word\\nabout supper, nor ever seemed to think about it\u2014and so they kept it up,\\nand kept it up; and it _was_ the worst mixed-up thing you ever see.\\nThey made the king tell his yarn, and they made the old gentleman tell\\nhis\u2019n; and anybody but a lot of prejudiced chuckleheads would a _seen_\\nthat the old gentleman was spinning truth and t\u2019other one lies. And\\nby-and-by they had me up to tell what I knowed. The king he give me a\\nleft-handed look out of the corner of his eye, and so I knowed enough\\nto talk on the right side. I begun to tell about Sheffield, and how we\\nlived there, and all about the English Wilkses, and so on; but I didn\u2019t\\nget pretty fur till the doctor begun to laugh; and Levi Bell, the\\nlawyer, says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T14:37:12Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1398, "name": "Chunk 1398", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XXIX", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cSet down, my boy; I wouldn\u2019t strain myself if I was you. I reckon you\\nain\u2019t used to lying, it don\u2019t seem to come handy; what you want is\\npractice. You do it pretty awkward.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"chunk_order_number": 1408, "name": "Chunk 1408", "description": "Text segment from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, it beats _me_\u201d\u2014and snaked a lot of old letters out of his\\npocket, and examined them, and then examined the old man\u2019s writing, and\\nthen _them_ again; and then says: \u201cThese old letters is from Harvey\\nWilks; and here\u2019s _these_ two handwritings, and anybody can see _they_\\ndidn\u2019t write them\u201d (the king and the duke looked sold and foolish, I\\ntell you, to see how the lawyer had took them in), \u201cand here\u2019s _this_\\nold gentleman\u2019s hand writing, and anybody can tell, easy enough, _he_\\ndidn\u2019t write them\u2014fact is, the scratches he makes ain\u2019t properly\\n_writing_ at all. I\u2019ve got some\\nof William\u2019s letters, too; so if you\u2019ll get him to write a line or so\\nwe can com\u2014\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1411, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:21Z"}

{"name": "writing ability", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cHe _can\u2019t_ write with his left hand,\u201d says the old gentleman. \u201cIf he\\ncould use his right hand, you would see that he wrote his own letters\\nand mine too. Look at both, please\u2014they\u2019re by the same hand.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1412, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:21Z"}

{"order_number": 1420, "name": "Chunk 1420", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "Blamed if the king didn\u2019t have to brace up mighty quick, or he\u2019d a\\nsqushed down like a bluff bank that the river has cut under, it took\\nhim so sudden; and, mind you, it was a thing that was calculated to\\nmake most _anybody_ sqush to get fetched such a solid one as that\\nwithout any notice, because how was _he_ going to know what was\\ntattooed on the man? He whitened a little; he couldn\u2019t help it; and it\\nwas mighty still in there, and everybody bending a little forwards and\\ngazing at him. Says I to myself, _Now_ he\u2019ll throw up the sponge\u2014there\\nain\u2019t no more use. Well, did he? A body can\u2019t hardly believe it, but he\\ndidn\u2019t. I reckon he thought he\u2019d keep the thing up till he tired them\\npeople out, so they\u2019d thin out, and him and the duke could break loose\\nand get away. Anyway, he set there, and pretty soon he begun to smile,\\nand says:", "chunk_order_number": 1420, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"chunk_order_number": 1421, "name": "Chunk 1421", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXIX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cMf! {"chunk_order_number": 1427, "name": "Chunk 1427", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXIX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cGood!\u201d says the old gentleman. \u201cNow, what you _did_ see on his breast\\nwas a small dim P, and a B (which is an initial he dropped when he was\\nyoung), and a W, with dashes between them, so: P\u2014B\u2014W\u201d\u2014and he marked\\nthem that way on a piece of paper. \u201cCome, ain\u2019t that what you saw?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:22Z"}

{"name": "P\u2014B\u2014W", "description": "Initials", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cGood!\u201d says the old gentleman. \u201cNow, what you _did_ see on his breast\\nwas a small dim P, and a B (which is an initial he dropped when he was\\nyoung), and a W, with dashes between them, so: P\u2014B\u2014W\u201d\u2014and he marked\\nthem that way on a piece of paper. \u201cCome, ain\u2019t that what you saw?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1427, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:22Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1437", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "I _was_ scared, now, I tell you. But there warn\u2019t no getting away, you\\nknow. {"chunk_order_number": 1439, "name": "Chunk 1439", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXIX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "Well, we swarmed along down the river road, just carrying on like\\nwildcats; and to make it more scary the sky was darking up, and the\\nlightning beginning to wink and flitter, and the wind to shiver amongst\\nthe leaves. This was the most awful trouble and most dangersome I ever\\nwas in; and I was kinder stunned; everything was going so different\\nfrom what I had allowed for; stead of being fixed so I could take my\\nown time if I wanted to, and see all the fun, and have Mary Jane at my\\nback to save me and set me free when the close-fit come, here was\\nnothing in the world betwixt me and sudden death but just them\\ntattoo-marks. If they didn\u2019t find them\u2014", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:24Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1440, "text": "I couldn\u2019t bear to think about it; and yet, somehow, I couldn\u2019t think\\nabout nothing else. {"chunk_order_number": 1442, "name": "Chunk 1442", "description": "Text content passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "So they dug and dug like everything; and it got awful dark, and the\\nrain started, and the wind swished and swushed along, and the lightning\\ncome brisker and brisker, and the thunder boomed; but them people never\\ntook no notice of it, they was so full of this business; and one minute\\nyou could see everything and every face in that big crowd, and the\\nshovelfuls of dirt sailing up out of the grave, and the next second the\\ndark wiped it all out, and you couldn\u2019t see nothing at all.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T14:39:25Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1443, "name": "Chunk 1443", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "At last they got out the coffin and begun to unscrew the lid, and then\\nsuch another crowding and shouldering and shoving as there was, to\\nscrouge in and get a sight, you never see; and in the dark, that way,\\nit was awful. {"chunk_order_number": 1447, "name": "Chunk 1447", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXIX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "I had the road all to myself, and I fairly flew\u2014leastways, I had it all\\nto myself except the solid dark, and the now-and-then glares, and the\\nbuzzing of the rain, and the thrashing of the wind, and the splitting\\nof the thunder; and sure as you are born I did clip it along!", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:26Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1448, "name": "Chunk 1448", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXIX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "When I struck the town I see there warn\u2019t nobody out in the storm, so I\\nnever hunted for no back streets, but humped it straight through the\\nmain one; and when I begun to get towards our house I aimed my eye and\\nset it. No light there; the house all dark\u2014which made me feel sorry and\\ndisappointed, I didn\u2019t know why. But at last, just as I was sailing by,\\n_flash_ comes the light in Mary Jane\u2019s window! and my heart swelled up\\nsudden, like to bust; and the same second the house and all was behind\\nme in the dark, and wasn\u2019t ever going to be before me no more in this\\nworld. She _was_ the best girl I ever see, and had the most sand.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:39:26Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1449", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "The minute I was far enough above the town to see I could make the\\ntow-head, I begun to look sharp for a boat to borrow, and the first time\\nthe lightning showed me one that wasn\u2019t chained I snatched it and\\nshoved. It was a canoe, and warn\u2019t fastened with nothing but a rope.\\nThe tow-head was a rattling big distance off, away out there in the\\nmiddle of the river, but I didn\u2019t lose no time; and when I struck the\\nraft at last I was so fagged I would a just laid down to blow and gasp\\nif I could afforded it. But I didn\u2019t. As I sprung aboard I sung out:", "chunk_order_number": 1449, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:26Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1450, "name": "Chunk 1450", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXIX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "\u201cOut with you, Jim, and set her loose! {"chunk_order_number": 1451, "name": "Chunk 1451", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXIX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "Jim lit out, and was a-coming for me with both arms spread, he was so\\nfull of joy; but when I glimpsed him in the lightning my heart shot up\\nin my mouth and I went overboard backwards; for I forgot he was old\\nKing Lear and a drownded A-rab all in one, and it most scared the\\nlivers and lights out of me. But Jim fished me out, and was going to\\nhug me and bless me, and so on, he was so glad I was back and we was\\nshut of the king and the duke, but I says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:26Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1453, "name": "Chunk 1453", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXIX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "So in two seconds away we went a-sliding down the river, and it _did_\\nseem so good to be free again and all by ourselves on the big river,\\nand nobody to bother us. I had to skip around a bit, and jump up and\\ncrack my heels a few times\u2014I couldn\u2019t help it; but about the third\\ncrack I noticed a sound that I knowed mighty well, and held my breath\\nand listened and waited; and sure enough, when the next flash busted\\nout over the water, here they come!\u2014and just a-laying to their oars and\\nmaking their skiff hum! It was the king and the duke.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-10-27T16:39:26Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1454, "name": "Chunk 1454", "description": "So I wilted right down on to the planks then, and give up; and it was\\nall I could do to keep from crying.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXIX.", "chunk": "So I wilted right down on to the planks then, and give up; and it was\\nall I could do to keep from crying.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:27Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1460, "name": "Chunk 1460", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cHonest, I\u2019ll tell you everything just as it happened, your majesty.\\nThe man that had a-holt of me was very good to me, and kept saying he\\nhad a boy about as big as me that died last year, and he was sorry to\\nsee a boy in such a dangerous fix; and when they was all took by\\nsurprise by finding the gold, and made a rush for the coffin, he lets\\ngo of me and whispers, \u2018Heel it now, or they\u2019ll hang ye, sure!\u2019 and I\\nlit out. It didn\u2019t seem no good for _me_ to stay\u2014_I_ couldn\u2019t do\\nnothing, and I didn\u2019t want to be hung if I could get away. So I never\\nstopped running till I found the canoe; and when I got here I told Jim\\nto hurry, or they\u2019d catch me and hang me yet, and said I was afeard you\\nand the duke wasn\u2019t alive now, and I was awful sorry, and so was Jim,\\nand was awful glad when we see you coming; you may ask Jim if I\\ndidn\u2019t.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:27Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1464, "name": "Chunk 1464", "description": "Text passage from chapter XXX", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cYou better a blame sight give _yourself_ a good cussing, for you\u2019re\\nthe one that\u2019s entitled to it most. You hain\u2019t done a thing from the\\nstart that had any sense in it, except coming out so cool and cheeky\\nwith that imaginary blue-arrow mark. That _was_ bright\u2014it was right\\ndown bully; and it was the thing that saved us. For if it hadn\u2019t been\\nfor that, they\u2019d a jailed us till them Englishmen\u2019s baggage come\u2014and\\nthen\u2014the penitentiary, you bet! But that trick took \u2019em to the\\ngraveyard, and the gold done us a still bigger kindness; for if the\\nexcited fools hadn\u2019t let go all holts and made that rush to get a look,\\nwe\u2019d a slept in our cravats to-night\u2014cravats warranted to _wear_,\\ntoo\u2014longer than _we\u2019d_ need \u2019em.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T15:43:00Z"}

But that trick took \u2019em to the\\ngraveyard, and the gold done us a still bigger kindness; for if the\\nexcited fools hadn\u2019t let go all holts and made that rush to get a look,\\nwe\u2019d a slept in our cravats to-night\u2014cravats warranted to _wear_,\\ntoo\u2014longer than _we\u2019d_ need \u2019em.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1464, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T15:43:00Z"}

{"name": "rush to get a look", "description": "The excited fools' action", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cYou better a blame sight give _yourself_ a good cussing, for you\u2019re\\nthe one that\u2019s entitled to it most. You hain\u2019t done a thing from the\\nstart that had any sense in it, except coming out so cool and cheeky\\nwith that imaginary blue-arrow mark. That _was_ bright\u2014it was right\\ndown bully; and it was the thing that saved us. For if it hadn\u2019t been\\nfor that, they\u2019d a jailed us till them Englishmen\u2019s baggage come\u2014and\\nthen\u2014the penitentiary, you bet!
