{"chunk_order_number": 1465, "content": "They was still a minute\u2014thinking; then the king says, kind of\\nabsent-minded like:", "name": "Chunk 1465", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "They was still a minute\u2014thinking; then the king says, kind of\\nabsent-minded like:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:27Z"}

{"text": "\u201cMf! And we reckoned the _niggers_ stole it!\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1466, "name": "Chunk 1466", "description": "Text content passage.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cMf! And we reckoned the _niggers_ stole it!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:28Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1467, "name": "That made me squirm!", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "That made me squirm!", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-26T15:25:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1468, "text": "\\\"Yes,\\\" says the duke, kinder slow and deliberate and sarcastic, \\\"_We_ did.\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1468", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cYes,\u201d says the duke, kinder slow and deliberate and sarcastic, \u201c_We_\\ndid.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:28Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1469, "text": "After about a half a minute the king drawls out:", "name": "Chunk 1469", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "After about a half a minute the king drawls out:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:28Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1470", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cLeastways, _I_ did.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1470, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:28Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1471", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "The duke says, the same way:", "chunk_order_number": 1471, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T16:39:28Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1472, "name": "Chunk 1472", "description": "\u201cOn the contrary, _I_ did.\u201d", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cOn the contrary, _I_ did.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-06-02T16:39:28Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1473, "text_content": "The king kind of ruffles up, and says:", "name": "Chunk 1473", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "The king kind of ruffles up, and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T12:34:56Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1474, "text": "\u201cLooky here, Bilgewater, what\u2019r you referrin\u2019 to?\u201d", "name": "Chunk_1474", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cLooky here, Bilgewater, what\u2019r you referrin\u2019 to?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:29Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1476, "text": "\u201cWhen it comes to that, maybe you\u2019ll let me ask, what was _you_ referring to?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1476", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cWhen it comes to that, maybe you\u2019ll let me ask, what was _you_\\nreferring to?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"chunk_order_number": 1477, "name": "Chunk 1477", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cShucks!\u201d says the king, very sarcastic; \u201cbut _I_ don\u2019t know\u2014maybe you\\nwas asleep, and didn\u2019t know what you was about.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-02-29T12:00:00Z"}

{"name": "sarcasm", "description": "The king's sarcastic tone", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cShucks!\u201d says the king, very sarcastic; \u201cbut _I_ don\u2019t know\u2014maybe you\\nwas asleep, and didn\u2019t know what you was about.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1477, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-02-29T12:00:00Z"}

{"name": "asleep", "description": "State of being asleep", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cShucks!\u201d says the king, very sarcastic; \u201cbut _I_ don\u2019t know\u2014maybe you\\nwas asleep, and didn\u2019t know what you was about.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1477, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-02-29T12:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1478, "name": "The duke bristles up now, and says:", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "The duke bristles up now, and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:30Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1479, "text": "\u201cOh, let _up_ on this cussed nonsense; do you take me for a blame\u2019 fool? Don\u2019t you reckon _I_ know who hid that money in that coffin?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1479", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cOh, let _up_ on this cussed nonsense; do you take me for a blame\u2019\\nfool? Don\u2019t you reckon _I_ know who hid that money in that coffin?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:30Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1480, "name": "Chunk 1480", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201c_Yes_, sir! I know you _do_ know, because you done it yourself!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:30Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1482, "text": "\u201cTake y\u2019r hands off!\u2014leggo my throat!\u2014I take it all back!\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1482", "description": "Text segment from chapter XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cTake y\u2019r hands off!\u2014leggo my throat!\u2014I take it all back!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1484, "name": "Chunk 1484", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, you just own up, first, that you _did_ hide that money there,\\nintending to give me the slip one of these days, and come back and dig\\nit up, and have it all to yourself.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"name": "Intention", "description": "The intention to hide the money.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, you just own up, first, that you _did_ hide that money there,\\nintending to give me the slip one of these days, and come back and dig\\nit up, and have it all to yourself.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1484, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1485, "text": "\u201cWait jest a minute, duke\u2014answer me this one question, honest and fair; if you didn\u2019t put the money there, say it, and I\u2019ll b\u2019lieve you, and take back everything I said.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1485", "description": "Text chunk from Chapter XXX", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cWait jest a minute, duke\u2014answer me this one question, honest and fair;\\nif you didn\u2019t put the money there, say it, and I\u2019ll b\u2019lieve you, and\\ntake back everything I said.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1486, "name": "Chunk 1486", "description": "Text chunk from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cYou old scoundrel, I didn\u2019t, and you know I didn\u2019t. There, now!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-26T10:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1488, "name": "Chunk 1488", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "The duke never said nothing for a little bit; then he says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1489, "name": "Chunk 1489", "description": "\u201cWell, I don\u2019t care if I _did_, I didn\u2019t _do_ it, anyway. But you not\\nonly had it in mind to do it, but you _done_ it.\u201d", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, I don\u2019t care if I _did_, I didn\u2019t _do_ it, anyway. But you not\\nonly had it in mind to do it, but you _done_ it.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"order_number": 1490, "name": "Chunk 1490", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cI wisht I never die if I done it, duke, and that\u2019s honest. I won\u2019t say\\nI warn\u2019t _goin_\u2019 to do it, because I _was;_ but you\u2014I mean somebody\u2014got\\nin ahead o\u2019 me.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1490, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"order_number": 1491, "name": "Chunk 1491", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cIt\u2019s a lie! You done it, and you got to _say_ you done it, or\u2014\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1491, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1492, "text": "The king began to gurgle, and then he gasps out:", "name": "Chunk 1492", "description": "Text content passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "The king began to gurgle, and then he gasps out:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:31Z"}

{"text": "\u2019Nough!\u2014_I own up!_", "name": "Chunk 1493", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201c\u2019Nough!\u2014_I own up!_\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1493, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:32Z"}

{"name": "Actor in context", "description": "Character or Actor in the context", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201c\u2019Nough!\u2014_I own up!_\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1493, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:32Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1494, "name": "Chunk 1494", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "I was very glad to hear him say that; it made me feel much more easier\\nthan what I was feeling before. So the duke took his hands off and\\nsays:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T12:34:56Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1495", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cIf you ever deny it again I\u2019ll drown you. It\u2019s _well_ for you to set\\nthere and blubber like a baby\u2014it\u2019s fitten for you, after the way you\u2019ve\\nacted. I never see such an old ostrich for wanting to gobble\\neverything\u2014and I a-trusting you all the time, like you was my own\\nfather. You ought to been ashamed of yourself to stand by and hear it\\nsaddled on to a lot of poor niggers, and you never say a word for \u2019em.\\nIt makes me feel ridiculous to think I was soft enough to _believe_\\nthat rubbage. Cuss you, I can see now why you was so anxious to make up\\nthe deffisit\u2014you wanted to get what money I\u2019d got out of the Nonesuch\\nand one thing or another, and scoop it _all!_\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1495, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"chunk_order_number": 1496, "content": "The king says, timid, and still a-snuffling:", "name": "Chunk 1496", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "The king says, timid, and still a-snuffling:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:32Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1497, "name": "Chunk_1497", "description": "\u201cWhy, duke, it was you that said make up the deffisit; it warn\u2019t me.\u201d", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, duke, it was you that said make up the deffisit; it warn\u2019t me.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:32Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1498, "text": "\\\"Dry up! I don\u2019t want to hear no more _out_ of you!\\\" says the duke. \\\"And _now_ you see what you _got_ by it. They\u2019ve got all their own money back, and all of _ourn_ but a shekel or two _besides_. G\u2019long to bed, and don\u2019t you deffersit _me_ no more deffersits, long \u2019s _you_ live!\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1498", "description": "Text passage from chapter XXX.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "\u201cDry up! I don\u2019t want to hear no more _out_ of you!\u201d says the duke.\\n\u201cAnd _now_ you see what you _got_ by it. They\u2019ve got all their own\\nmoney back, and all of _ourn_ but a shekel or two _besides_. G\u2019long to\\nbed, and don\u2019t you deffersit _me_ no more deffersits, long \u2019s _you_\\nlive!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:16:49Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1499, "name": "Chunk 1499", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XXX", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXX.", "chunk": "So the king sneaked into the wigwam and took to his bottle for comfort,\\nand before long the duke tackled _his_ bottle; and so in about a half\\nan hour they was as thick as thieves again, and the tighter they got,\\nthe lovinger they got, and went off a-snoring in each other\u2019s arms.\\nThey both got powerful mellow, but I noticed the king didn\u2019t get mellow\\nenough to forget to remember to not deny about hiding the money-bag\\nagain. That made me feel easy and satisfied. Of course when they got to\\nsnoring we had a long gabble, and I told Jim everything.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T15:55:00Z"}

{"name": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "description": "Chapter XXXI of the book", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "We dasn\u2019t stop again at any town for days and days; kept right along\\ndown the river. We was down south in the warm weather now, and a mighty\\nlong ways from home. We begun to come to trees with Spanish moss on\\nthem, hanging down from the limbs like long, gray beards. It was the\\nfirst I ever see it growing, and it made the woods look solemn and\\ndismal. So now the frauds reckoned they was out of danger, and they\\nbegun to work the villages again.", "chunk_order_number": 1500, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-10-27T10:20:00Z"}

So now the frauds reckoned they was out of danger, and they\\nbegun to work the villages again.", "chunk_order_number": 1500, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-10-27T10:20:00Z"}

{"name": "solemn and dismal", "description": "Abstract concept", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "We dasn\u2019t stop again at any town for days and days; kept right along\\ndown the river. It was the\\nfirst I ever see it growing, and it made the woods look solemn and\\ndismal. So now the frauds reckoned they was out of danger, and they\\nbegun to work the villages again.", "chunk_order_number": 1500, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-10-27T10:20:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1501, "name": "Chunk 1501", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXXI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "First they done a lecture on temperance; but they didn\u2019t make enough\\nfor them both to get drunk on. Then in another village they started a\\ndancing-school; but they didn\u2019t know no more how to dance than a\\nkangaroo does; so the first prance they made the general public jumped\\nin and pranced them out of town. Another time they tried to go at\\nyellocution; but they didn\u2019t yellocute long till the audience got up\\nand give them a solid good cussing, and made them skip out. They\\ntackled missionarying, and mesmerizing, and doctoring, and telling\\nfortunes, and a little of everything; but they couldn\u2019t seem to have no\\nluck. So at last they got just about dead broke, and laid around the\\nraft as she floated along, thinking and thinking, and never saying\\nnothing, by the half a day at a time, and dreadful blue and desperate.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-05-23T14:20:13Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1502, "name": "Chunk 1502", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXXI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "And at last they took a change and begun to lay their heads together in\\nthe wigwam and talk low and confidential two or three hours at a time.\\nJim and me got uneasy. We didn\u2019t like the look of it. We judged they\\nwas studying up some kind of worse deviltry than ever. We turned it\\nover and over, and at last we made up our minds they was going to break\\ninto somebody\u2019s house or store, or was going into the counterfeit-money\\nbusiness, or something. So then we was pretty scared, and made up an\\nagreement that we wouldn\u2019t have nothing in the world to do with such\\nactions, and if we ever got the least show we would give them the cold\\nshake and clear out and leave them behind. Well, early one morning we\\nhid the raft in a good, safe place about two mile below a little bit of\\na shabby village named Pikesville, and the king he went ashore and told\\nus all to stay hid whilst he went up to town and smelt around to see if\\nanybody had got any wind of the Royal Nonesuch there yet. (\u201cHouse...", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:33Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1503, "text": "So we stayed where we was. The duke he fretted and sweated around, and\\nwas in a mighty sour way. He scolded us for everything, and we couldn\u2019t\\nseem to do nothing right; he found fault with every little thing.\\nSomething was a-brewing, sure. I was good and glad when midday come and\\nno king; we could have a change, anyway\u2014and maybe a chance for _the_\\nchange on top of it. So me and the duke went up to the village, and\\nhunted around there for the king, and by-and-by we found him in the\\nback room of a little low doggery, very tight, and a lot of loafers\\nbullyragging him for sport, and he a-cussing and a-threatening with all\\nhis might, and so tight he couldn\u2019t walk, and couldn\u2019t do nothing to\\nthem. {"chunk_order_number": 1517, "name": "Chunk_1517", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "I didn\u2019t have none, so he left. I went to the raft, and set down in the\\nwigwam to think. But I couldn\u2019t come to nothing. I thought till I wore\\nmy head sore, but I couldn\u2019t see no way out of the trouble. After all\\nthis long journey, and after all we\u2019d done for them scoundrels, here it\\nwas all come to nothing, everything all busted up and ruined, because\\nthey could have the heart to serve Jim such a trick as that, and make\\nhim a slave again all his life, and amongst strangers, too, for forty\\ndirty dollars.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:34Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1518, "name": "Chunk 1518", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XXXI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "Once I said to myself it would be a thousand times better for Jim to be\\na slave at home where his family was, as long as he\u2019d _got_ to be a\\nslave, and so I\u2019d better write a letter to Tom Sawyer and tell him to\\ntell Miss Watson where he was. But I soon give up that notion for two\\nthings: she\u2019d be mad and disgusted at his rascality and ungratefulness\\nfor leaving her, and so she\u2019d sell him straight down the river again;\\nand if she didn\u2019t, everybody naturally despises an ungrateful nigger,\\nand they\u2019d make Jim feel it all the time, and so he\u2019d feel ornery and\\ndisgraced. And then think of _me!_ It would get all around that Huck\\nFinn helped a nigger to get his freedom; and if I was ever to see\\nanybody from that town again I\u2019d be ready to get down and lick his\\nboots for shame. That\u2019s just the way: a person does a low-down thing,\\nand then he don\u2019t want to take no consequences of it. Thinks as long as\\nhe can hide it, it ain\u2019t no disgrace. That was my fix exactly. The more\\nI stud...", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:34Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1519, "content": "It made me shiver. And I about made up my mind to pray, and see if I\\ncouldn\u2019t try to quit being the kind of a boy I was and be better. So I\\nkneeled down. But the words wouldn\u2019t come. Why wouldn\u2019t they? It warn\u2019t\\nno use to try and hide it from Him. Nor from _me_, neither. I knowed\\nvery well why they wouldn\u2019t come. It was because my heart warn\u2019t right;\\nit was because I warn\u2019t square; it was because I was playing double. I\\nwas letting _on_ to give up sin, but away inside of me I was holding on\\nto the biggest one of all. I was trying to make my mouth _say_ I would\\ndo the right thing and the clean thing, and go and write to that\\nnigger\u2019s owner and tell where he was; but deep down in me I knowed it\\nwas a lie, and He knowed it. You can\u2019t pray a lie\u2014I found that out.", "name": "Chunk 1519", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "It made me shiver. It was because my heart warn\u2019t right;\\nit was because I warn\u2019t square; it was because I was playing double. I was trying to make my mouth _say_ I would\\ndo the right thing and the clean thing, and go and write to that\\nnigger\u2019s owner and tell where he was; but deep down in me I knowed it\\nwas a lie, and He knowed it. {"name": "Chunk 1523", "description": "I felt good and all washed clean of sin for the first time I had ever felt so in my life, and I knowed I could pray now. And got to thinking over our\\ntrip down the river; and I see Jim before me all the time: in the day\\nand in the night-time, sometimes moonlight, sometimes storms, and we\\na-floating along, talking and singing and laughing. But somehow I\\ncouldn\u2019t seem to strike no places to harden me against him, but only\\nthe other kind. I\u2019d see him standing my watch on top of his\u2019n, \u2019stead\\nof calling me, so I could go on sleeping; and see him how glad he was\\nwhen I come back out of the fog; and when I come to him again in the\\nswamp, up there where the feud was; and such-like times; and would\\nalways call me honey, and pet me and do everything he could think of\\nfor me, and ...", "chunk_order_number": 1523, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:35Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1526, "text": "It was awful thoughts and awful words, but they was said. And I let\\nthem stay said; and never thought no more about reforming. I shoved the\\nwhole thing out of my head, and said I would take up wickedness again,\\nwhich was in my line, being brung up to it, and the other warn\u2019t. {"name": "Chunk 1527", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "Then I set to thinking over how to get at it, and turned over some\\nconsiderable many ways in my mind; and at last fixed up a plan that\\nsuited me. So then I took the bearings of a woody island that was down\\nthe river a piece, and as soon as it was fairly dark I crept out with\\nmy raft and went for it, and hid it there, and then turned in. I slept\\nthe night through, and got up before it was light, and had my\\nbreakfast, and put on my store clothes, and tied up some others and one\\nthing or another in a bundle, and took the canoe and cleared for shore.\\nI landed below where I judged was Phelps\u2019s place, and hid my bundle in\\nthe woods, and then filled up the canoe with water, and loaded rocks\\ninto her and sunk her where I could find her again when I wanted her,\\nabout a quarter of a mile below a little steam sawmill that was on the\\nbank.", "chunk_order_number": 1527, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:35Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1528, "name": "Chunk 1528", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XXXI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "Then I struck up the road, and when I passed the mill I see a sign on\\nit, \u201cPhelps\u2019s Sawmill,\u201d and when I come to the farm-houses, two or\\nthree hundred yards further along, I kept my eyes peeled, but didn\u2019t\\nsee nobody around, though it was good daylight now. But I didn\u2019t mind,\\nbecause I didn\u2019t want to see nobody just yet\u2014I only wanted to get the\\nlay of the land. According to my plan, I was going to turn up there\\nfrom the village, not from below. So I just took a look, and shoved\\nalong, straight for town. Well, the very first man I see when I got\\nthere was the duke. He was sticking up a bill for the Royal\\nNonesuch\u2014three-night performance\u2014like that other time. _They_ had the\\ncheek, them frauds! I was right on him before I could shirk. He looked\\nastonished, and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:35Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1534, "name": "Chunk_1534", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXI.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell,\u201d I says, \u201cwhen I see the king in that doggery yesterday I says\\nto myself, we can\u2019t get him home for hours, till he\u2019s soberer; so I\\nwent a-loafing around town to put in the time and wait. A man up and\\noffered me ten cents to help him pull a skiff over the river and back\\nto fetch a sheep, and so I went along; but when we was dragging him to\\nthe boat, and the man left me a-holt of the rope and went behind him to\\nshove him along, he was too strong for me and jerked loose and run, and\\nwe after him. We didn\u2019t have no dog, and so we had to chase him all\\nover the country till we tired him out. We never got him till dark;\\nthen we fetched him over, and I started down for the raft. When I got\\nthere and see it was gone, I says to myself, \u2018they\u2019ve got into trouble\\nand had to leave; and they\u2019ve took my nigger, which is the only nigger\\nI\u2019ve got in the world, and now I\u2019m in a strange country, and ain\u2019t got\\nno property no more, nor nothing, and no way to make my living;\u2019 so I\\nse...", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:36Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1535, "name": "Chunk 1535", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXXI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "\u201cBlamed if _I_ know\u2014that is, what\u2019s become of the raft. {"chunk_order_number": 1543, "name": "Chunk 1543", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXXI", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, you can\u2019t _get_ your nigger, that\u2019s all\u2014so dry up your\\nblubbering. {"chunk_order_number": 1554, "name": "Chunk 1554", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "\u201cSo clear out,\u201d he says; \u201cand you can tell Mr. Foster whatever you want\\nto. Maybe you can get him to believe that Jim _is_ your nigger\u2014some\\nidiots don\u2019t require documents\u2014leastways I\u2019ve heard there\u2019s such down\\nSouth here. And when you tell him the handbill and the reward\u2019s bogus,\\nmaybe he\u2019ll believe you when you explain to him what the idea was for\\ngetting \u2019em out. Go \u2019long now, and tell him anything you want to; but\\nmind you don\u2019t work your jaw any _between_ here and there.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:39Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1555, "name": "Chunk 1555", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXI.", "chunk": "So I left, and struck for the back country. I didn\u2019t look around, but I\\nkinder felt like he was watching me. But I knowed I could tire him out\\nat that. I went straight out in the country as much as a mile before I\\nstopped; then I doubled back through the woods towards Phelps\u2019. I\\nreckoned I better start in on my plan straight off without fooling\\naround, because I wanted to stop Jim\u2019s mouth till these fellows could\\nget away. I didn\u2019t want no trouble with their kind. I\u2019d seen all I\\nwanted to of them, and wanted to get entirely shut of them.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:39Z"}

{"name": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "When I got there it was all still and Sunday-like, and hot and\\nsunshiny; the hands was gone to the fields; and there was them kind of\\nfaint dronings of bugs and flies in the air that makes it seem so\\nlonesome and like everybody\u2019s dead and gone; and if a breeze fans along\\nand quivers the leaves it makes you feel mournful, because you feel\\nlike it\u2019s spirits whispering\u2014spirits that\u2019s been dead ever so many\\nyears\u2014and you always think they\u2019re talking about _you_. As a general\\nthing it makes a body wish _he_ was dead, too, and done with it all.", "chunk_order_number": 1556, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:39Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1558, "name": "Chunk 1558", "description": "Text segment from chapter XXXII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "I went around and clumb over the back stile by the ash-hopper, and\\nstarted for the kitchen. When I got a little ways I heard the dim hum\\nof a spinning-wheel wailing along up and sinking along down again; and\\nthen I knowed for certain I wished I was dead\u2014for that _is_ the\\nlonesomest sound in the whole world.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:39Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1559", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "I went right along, not fixing up any particular plan, but just\\ntrusting to Providence to put the right words in my mouth when the time\\ncome; for I\u2019d noticed that Providence always did put the right words in\\nmy mouth if I left it alone.", "chunk_order_number": 1559, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:39Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1560, "content": "When I got half-way, first one hound and then another got up and went\\nfor me, and of course I stopped and faced them, and kept still. And\\nsuch another powwow as they made! In a quarter of a minute I was a kind\\nof a hub of a wheel, as you may say\u2014spokes made out of dogs\u2014circle of\\nfifteen of them packed together around me, with their necks and noses\\nstretched up towards me, a-barking and howling; and more a-coming; you\\ncould see them sailing over fences and around corners from everywheres.", "name": "Chunk 1560", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXXII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "When I got half-way, first one hound and then another got up and went\\nfor me, and of course I stopped and faced them, and kept still. {"chunk_order_number": 1561, "text": "A nigger woman come tearing out of the kitchen with a rolling-pin in\\nher hand, singing out, \u201cBegone _you_ Tige! you Spot! begone sah!\u201d and\\nshe fetched first one and then another of them a clip and sent them\\nhowling, and then the rest followed; and the next second half of them\\ncome back, wagging their tails around me, and making friends with me.\\nThere ain\u2019t no harm in a hound, nohow.", "name": "Chunk 1561", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "A nigger woman come tearing out of the kitchen with a rolling-pin in\\nher hand, singing out, \u201cBegone _you_ Tige! you Spot! begone sah!\u201d and\\nshe fetched first one and then another of them a clip and sent them\\nhowling, and then the rest followed; and the next second half of them\\ncome back, wagging their tails around me, and making friends with me.\\nThere ain\u2019t no harm in a hound, nohow.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:40Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1562, "name": "Chunk 1562", "description": "Text segment within CHAPTER XXXII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "And behind the woman comes a little nigger girl and two little nigger\\nboys without anything on but tow-linen shirts, and they hung on to\\ntheir mother\u2019s gown, and peeped out from behind her at me, bashful, the\\nway they always do. And here comes the white woman running from the\\nhouse, about forty-five or fifty year old, bareheaded, and her\\nspinning-stick in her hand; and behind her comes her little white\\nchildren, acting the same way the little niggers was doing. That didn\u2019t help me much, though; for I didn\u2019t know the names\\nof bars down that way. {"order_number": 1576, "name": "Chunk 1576", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, it\u2019s lucky; because sometimes people do get hurt. Two years ago\\nlast Christmas your uncle Silas was coming up from Newrleans on the old\\n_Lally Rook_, and she blowed out a cylinder-head and crippled a man.\\nAnd I think he died afterwards. He was a Baptist. Your uncle Silas\\nknowed a family in Baton Rouge that knowed his people very well. Yes, I\\nremember now, he _did_ die. Mortification set in, and they had to\\namputate him. But it didn\u2019t save him. Yes, it was mortification\u2014that\\nwas it. He turned blue all over, and died in the hope of a glorious\\nresurrection. They say he was a sight to look at. Your uncle\u2019s been up\\nto the town every day to fetch you. And he\u2019s gone again, not more\u2019n an\\nhour ago; he\u2019ll be back any minute now. {"order_number": 1594, "text": "\u201cI can\u2019t imagine,\u201d says the old gentleman; \u201cand I must say it makes me dreadful uneasy.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1594", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "\u201cI can\u2019t imagine,\u201d says the old gentleman; \u201cand I must say it makes me\\ndreadful uneasy.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1594, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-06-01T16:39:44Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1595, "name": "Chunk 1595", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "\u201cUneasy!\u201d she says; \u201cI\u2019m ready to go distracted! {"name": "Chunk 1606", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "But if they was joyful, it warn\u2019t nothing to what I was; for it was\\nlike being born again, I was so glad to find out who I was. Well, they\\nfroze to me for two hours; and at last, when my chin was so tired it\\ncouldn\u2019t hardly go any more, I had told them more about my family\u2014I\\nmean the Sawyer family\u2014than ever happened to any six Sawyer families.\\nAnd I explained all about how we blowed out a cylinder-head at the\\nmouth of White River, and it took us three days to fix it. {"name": "The Sawyer family", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "But if they was joyful, it warn\u2019t nothing to what I was; for it was\\nlike being born again, I was so glad to find out who I was. {"name": "Chunk 1607", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXII.", "chunk": "Now I was feeling pretty comfortable all down one side, and pretty\\nuncomfortable all up the other. Being Tom Sawyer was easy and\\ncomfortable, and it stayed easy and comfortable till by-and-by I hear a\\nsteamboat coughing along down the river. Then I says to myself, s\u2019pose\\nTom Sawyer comes down on that boat? And s\u2019pose he steps in here any\\nminute, and sings out my name before I can throw him a wink to keep\\nquiet? Well, I couldn\u2019t _have_ it that way; it wouldn\u2019t do at all. I\\nmust go up the road and waylay him. So I told the folks I reckoned I\\nwould go up to the town and fetch down my baggage. {"chunk_order_number": 1636, "text": "Everybody made a rush for the front door, because, of course, a\\nstranger don\u2019t come _every_ year, and so he lays over the yaller-fever,\\nfor interest, when he does come. Tom had his store clothes on, and\\nan audience\u2014and that was always nuts for Tom Sawyer. In them\\ncircumstances it warn\u2019t no trouble to him to throw in an amount of\\nstyle that was suitable. {"name": "Home", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cOh, _do_,\u201d says Aunt Sally; \u201cit ain\u2019t a bit of trouble to us, not a\\nbit in the world. You _must_ stay. It\u2019s a long, dusty three mile, and\\nwe _can\u2019t_ let you walk. And, besides, I\u2019ve already told \u2019em to put on\\nanother plate when I see you coming; so you mustn\u2019t disappoint us. Come\\nright in and make yourself at home.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1643, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T12:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1644, "text": "So Tom he thanked them very hearty and handsome, and let himself be persuaded, and come in; and when he was in he said he was a stranger from Hicksville, Ohio, and his name was William Thompson\u2014and he made another bow.", "name": "Chunk 1644", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "So Tom he thanked them very hearty and handsome, and let himself be\\npersuaded, and come in; and when he was in he said he was a stranger\\nfrom Hicksville, Ohio, and his name was William Thompson\u2014and he made\\nanother bow.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T13:00:00Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1645", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "Well, he run on, and on, and on, making up stuff about Hicksville and\\neverybody in it he could invent, and I getting a little nervious, and\\nwondering how this was going to help me out of my scrape; and at last,\\nstill talking along, he reached over and kissed Aunt Sally right on the\\nmouth, and then settled back again in his chair comfortable, and was\\ngoing on talking; but she jumped up and wiped it off with the back of\\nher hand, and says:", "chunk_order_number": 1645, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:50Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1658, "name": "Chunk 1658", "description": "Text segment of a chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "He got up and looked distressed, and fumbled his hat, and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T12:00:00Z"}

{"order_number": 1659, "text": "\u201cI\u2019m sorry, and I warn\u2019t expecting it. They told me to. They all told\\nme to. They all said, kiss her; and said she\u2019d like it. They all said\\nit\u2014every one of them. But I\u2019m sorry, m\u2019am, and I won\u2019t do it no more\u2014I\\nwon\u2019t, honest.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1659", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cI\u2019m sorry, and I warn\u2019t expecting it. They told me to. They all told\\nme to. They all said, kiss her; and said she\u2019d like it. They all said\\nit\u2014every one of them. But I\u2019m sorry, m\u2019am, and I won\u2019t do it no more\u2014I\\nwon\u2019t, honest.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1659, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T10:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1660, "name": "Chunk_1660", "description": "\\\\\"You won\u2019t, won\u2019t you? Well, I sh\u2019d _reckon_ you won\u2019t!\\\\\"", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cYou won\u2019t, won\u2019t you? Well, I sh\u2019d _reckon_ you won\u2019t!\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:52Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1661, "content": "\u201cNo\u2019m, I\u2019m honest about it; I won\u2019t ever do it again\u2014till you ask me.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1661", "description": "Text segment", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cNo\u2019m, I\u2019m honest about it; I won\u2019t ever do it again\u2014till you ask me.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-02-29T12:34:56Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1662, "name": "Chunk 1662", "description": "\u201cTill I _ask_ you! Well, I never see the beat of it in my born days! I\\nlay you\u2019ll be the Methusalem-numskull of creation before ever I ask\\nyou\u2014or the likes of you.\u201d", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cTill I _ask_ you! Well, I never see the beat of it in my born days! I\\nlay you\u2019ll be the Methusalem-numskull of creation before ever I ask\\nyou\u2014or the likes of you.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T12:34:56Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1663, "name": "Chunk 1663", "description": "Text passage from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWell,\u201d he says, \u201cit does surprise me so. I can\u2019t make it out, somehow.\\nThey said you would, and I thought you would. But\u2014\u201d He stopped and\\nlooked around slow, like he wished he could run across a friendly eye\\nsomewheres, and fetched up on the old gentleman\u2019s, and says, \u201cDidn\u2019t\\n_you_ think she\u2019d like me to kiss her, sir?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:53Z"}

{"name": "\u201cWhy, no; I\u2014I\u2014well, no, I b\u2019lieve I didn\u2019t.\u201d", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, no; I\u2014I\u2014well, no, I b\u2019lieve I didn\u2019t.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1664, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:53Z"}

{"order_number": 1665, "name": "Chunk 1665", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXXIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "Then he looks on around the same way to me, and says:", "chunk_order_number": 1665, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:53Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1666, "text": "\u201cTom, didn\u2019t _you_ think Aunt Sally \u2019d open out her arms and say, \u2018Sid Sawyer\u2014\u2019\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1666", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cTom, didn\u2019t _you_ think Aunt Sally \u2019d open out her arms and say, \u2018Sid\\nSawyer\u2014\u2019\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:53Z"}

{"name": "Sid Sawyer", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cTom, didn\u2019t _you_ think Aunt Sally \u2019d open out her arms and say, \u2018Sid\\nSawyer\u2014\u2019\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1666, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:53Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1668, "name": "Chunk 1668", "description": "Text segment within CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, not till you\u2019ve asked me first.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:54Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1669, "name": "Chunk 1669", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "So she didn\u2019t lose no time, but asked him; and hugged him and kissed\\nhim over and over again, and then turned him over to the old man, and\\nhe took what was left. And after they got a little quiet again she\\nsays:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:54Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1670, "text": "\u201cWhy, dear me, I never see such a surprise. We warn\u2019t looking for _you_ at all, but only Tom. Sis never wrote to me about anybody coming but him.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1670", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, dear me, I never see such a surprise. We warn\u2019t looking for _you_\\nat all, but only Tom. Sis never wrote to me about anybody coming but\\nhim.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:54Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1671, "name": "Chunk 1671", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cIt\u2019s because it warn\u2019t _intended_ for any of us to come but Tom,\u201d he\\nsays; \u201cbut I begged and begged, and at the last minute she let me come,\\ntoo; so, coming down the river, me and Tom thought it would be a\\nfirst-rate surprise for him to come here to the house first, and for me\\nto by-and-by tag along and drop in, and let on to be a stranger. But it\\nwas a mistake, Aunt Sally. This ain\u2019t no healthy place for a stranger\\nto come.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T00:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1672, "text": "\u201cNo\u2014not impudent whelps, Sid. You ought to had your jaws boxed; I hain\u2019t been so put out since I don\u2019t know when. {"chunk_order_number": 1673, "name": "Chunk_1673", "description": "We had dinner out in that broad open passage betwixt the house and the\\nkitchen; and there was things enough on that table for seven\\nfamilies\u2014and all hot, too; none of your flabby, tough meat that\u2019s laid\\nin a cupboard in a damp cellar all night and tastes like a hunk of old\\ncold cannibal in the morning. Uncle Silas he asked a pretty long\\nblessing over it, but it was worth it; and it didn\u2019t cool it a bit,\\ neither, the way I\u2019ve seen them kind of interruptions do lots of times.\\nThere was a considerable good deal of talk all the afternoon, and me\\nand Tom was on the lookout all the time; but it warn\u2019t no use, they\\ndidn\u2019t happen to say nothing about any runaway nigger, and we was\\nafraid to try to work up to it. {"order_number": 1674, "text": "\u201cPa, mayn\u2019t Tom and Sid and me go to the show?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1674", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cPa, mayn\u2019t Tom and Sid and me go to the show?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1674, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:54Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1675, "name": "Chunk_1675", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "\u201cNo,\u201d says the old man, \u201cI reckon there ain\u2019t going to be any; and you\\ncouldn\u2019t go if there was; because the runaway nigger told Burton and me\\nall about that scandalous show, and Burton said he would tell the\\npeople; so I reckon they\u2019ve drove the owdacious loafers out of town\\nbefore this time.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T18:46:07Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1676, "name": "Chunk 1676", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "So there it was!\u2014but _I_ couldn\u2019t help it. Tom and me was to sleep in\\nthe same room and bed; so, being tired, we bid good-night and went up\\nto bed right after supper, and clumb out of the window and down the\\nlightning-rod, and shoved for the town; for I didn\u2019t believe anybody\\nwas going to give the king and the duke a hint, and so if I didn\u2019t\\nhurry up and give them one they\u2019d get into trouble sure.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:54Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1677, "name": "Chunk 1677", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXXIII", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIII.", "chunk": "On the road Tom he told me all about how it was reckoned I was\\nmurdered, and how pap disappeared pretty soon, and didn\u2019t come back no\\nmore, and what a stir there was when Jim run away; and I told Tom all\\nabout our Royal Nonesuch rapscallions, and as much of the raft voyage\\nas I had time to; and as we struck into the town and up through the the\\nmiddle of it\u2014it was as much as half-after eight, then\u2014here comes a\\nraging rush of people with torches, and an awful whooping and yelling,\\nand banging tin pans and blowing horns; and we jumped to one side to\\nlet them go by; and as they went by I see they had the king and the\\nduke astraddle of a rail\u2014that is, I knowed it _was_ the king and the\\nduke, though they was all over tar and feathers, and didn\u2019t look like\\nnothing in the world that was human\u2014just looked like a couple of\\nmonstrous big soldier-plumes. Well, it made me sick to see it; and I\\nwas sorry for them poor pitiful rascals, it seemed like I couldn\u2019t ever\\nfeel any hardness...", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-11-19T05:10:22Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1679, "text": "So we poked along back home, and I warn\u2019t feeling so brash as I was before, but kind of ornery, and humble, and to blame, somehow\u2014though _I_ hadn\u2019t done nothing. But that\u2019s always the way; it don\u2019t make no difference whether you do right or wrong, a person\u2019s conscience ain\u2019t got no sense, and just goes for him _anyway_. If I had a yaller dog that didn\u2019t know no more than a person\u2019s conscience does I would pison him. It takes up more room than all the rest of a person\u2019s insides, and yet ain\u2019t no good, nohow. {"order_number": 1690, "name": "Chunk 1690", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cSo it was\u2014I noticed it. It shows how a body can see and\\ndon\u2019t see at the same time.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1690, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-20T12:34:56Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1691, "name": "Chunk_1691", "description": "Text passage from chapter XXXIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, the nigger unlocked the padlock when he went in, and he locked\\nit again when he came out. He fetched uncle a key about the time we got\\nup from table\u2014same key, I bet. Watermelon shows man, lock shows\\nprisoner; and it ain\u2019t likely there\u2019s two prisoners on such a little\\nplantation, and where the people\u2019s all so kind and good. Jim\u2019s the\\nprisoner. All right\u2014I\u2019m glad we found it out detective fashion; I\\nwouldn\u2019t give shucks for any other way. Now you work your mind, and\\nstudy out a plan to steal Jim, and I will study out one, too; and we\u2019ll\\ntake the one we like the best.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-06-28T14:47:10Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1696, "name": "Chunk 1696", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cMy plan is this,\u201d I says. \u201cWe can easy find out if it\u2019s Jim in there.\\nThen get up my canoe to-morrow night, and fetch my raft over from the\\nisland. Then the first dark night that comes steal the key out of the\\nold man\u2019s britches after he goes to bed, and shove off down the river\\non the raft with Jim, hiding daytimes and running nights, the way me\\nand Jim used to do before. Wouldn\u2019t that plan work?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:57Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1697, "text": "\\\"_Work?_ Why, cert\u2019nly it would work, like rats a-fighting. But it\u2019s\\ntoo blame\u2019 simple; there ain\u2019t nothing _to_ it. What\u2019s the good of a\\nplan that ain\u2019t no more trouble than that? It\u2019s as mild as goose-milk.\\nWhy, Huck, it wouldn\u2019t make no more talk than breaking into a soap\\nfactory.\\\"", "name": "Chunk_1697", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201c_Work?_ Why, cert\u2019nly it would work, like rats a-fighting. But it\u2019s\\ntoo blame\u2019 simple; there ain\u2019t nothing _to_ it. What\u2019s the good of a\\nplan that ain\u2019t no more trouble than that? It\u2019s as mild as goose-milk.\\nWhy, Huck, it wouldn\u2019t make no more talk than breaking into a soap\\nfactory.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:57Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1698, "text": "I never said nothing, because I warn\u2019t expecting nothing different; but\\nI knowed mighty well that whenever he got _his_ plan ready it wouldn\u2019t\\nhave none of them objections to it.", "name": "Chunk 1698", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "I never said nothing, because I warn\u2019t expecting nothing different; but\\nI knowed mighty well that whenever he got _his_ plan ready it wouldn\u2019t\\nhave none of them objections to it.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:57Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1699, "name": "Chunk 1699", "description": "Text content passage from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "And it didn\u2019t. He told me what it was, and I see in a minute it was\\nworth fifteen of mine for style, and would make Jim just as free a man\\nas mine would, and maybe get us all killed besides. So I was satisfied,\\nand said we would waltz in on it. I needn\u2019t tell what it was here,\\nbecause I knowed it wouldn\u2019t stay the way, it was. I knowed he would be\\nchanging it around every which way as we went along, and heaving in new\\nbullinesses wherever he got a chance. And that is what he done.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:57Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1700, "name": "Chunk 1700", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Well, one thing was dead sure, and that was that Tom Sawyer was in\\nearnest, and was actuly going to help steal that nigger out of slavery.\\nThat was the thing that was too many for me. Here was a boy that was\\nrespectable and well brung up; and had a character to lose; and folks\\nat home that had characters; and he was bright and not leather-headed;\\nand knowing and not ignorant; and not mean, but kind; and yet here he\\nwas, without any more pride, or rightness, or feeling, than to stoop to\\nthis business, and make himself a shame, and his family a shame, before\\neverybody. I _couldn\u2019t_ understand it no way at all. It was outrageous,\\nand I knowed I ought to just up and tell him so; and so be his true\\nfriend, and let him quit the thing right where he was and save himself.\\nAnd I _did_ start to tell him; but he shut me up, and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:57Z"}

{"name": "willingness", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "That\u2019s all he said, and that\u2019s all I said. It warn\u2019t no use to say any\\nmore; because when he said he\u2019d do a thing, he always done it. But _I_\\ncouldn\u2019t make out how he was willing to go into this thing; so I just\\nlet it go, and never bothered no more about it. If he was bound to have\\nit so, _I_ couldn\u2019t help it.", "chunk_order_number": 1706, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:58Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1707, "name": "Chunk 1707", "description": "Text segment from Chapter XXXIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "When we got home the house was all dark and still; so we went on down\\nto the hut by the ash-hopper for to examine it. We went through the\\nyard so as to see what the hounds would do. They knowed us, and didn\u2019t\\nmake no more noise than country dogs is always doing when anything\\ncomes by in the night. When we got to the cabin we took a look at the\\nfront and the two sides; and on the side I warn\u2019t acquainted with\u2014which\\nwas the north side\u2014we found a square window-hole, up tolerable high,\\nwith just one stout board nailed across it. I says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:58Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1710", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cIt\u2019s as simple as tit-tat-toe, three-in-a-row, and as easy as playing\\nhooky. I should _hope_ we can find a way that\u2019s a little more\\ncomplicated than _that_, Huck Finn.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1710, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:58Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1711, "text": "\u201cWell, then,\u201d I says, \u201chow\u2019ll it do to saw him out, the way I done\\nbefore I was murdered that time?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1711", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, then,\u201d I says, \u201chow\u2019ll it do to saw him out, the way I done\\nbefore I was murdered that time?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:58Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1712", "description": "\u201cThat\u2019s more _like_,\u201d he says. \u201cIt\u2019s real mysterious, and troublesome, and good,\u201d he says; \u201cbut I bet we can find a way that\u2019s twice as long. There ain\u2019t no hurry; le\u2019s keep on looking around.\u201d", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cThat\u2019s more _like_,\u201d he says. \u201cIt\u2019s real mysterious, and troublesome,\\nand good,\u201d he says; \u201cbut I bet we can find a way that\u2019s twice as long.\\nThere ain\u2019t no hurry; le\u2019s keep on looking around.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1712, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"name": "Chunk 1713", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Betwixt the hut and the fence, on the back side, was a lean-to that\\njoined the hut at the eaves, and was made out of plank. It was as long\\nas the hut, but narrow\u2014only about six foot wide. The door to it was at\\nthe south end, and was padlocked. Tom he went to the soap-kettle and\\nsearched around, and fetched back the iron thing they lift the lid\\nwith; so he took it and prized out one of the staples. The chain fell\\ndown, and we opened the door and went in, and shut it, and struck a\\nmatch, and see the shed was only built against a cabin and hadn\u2019t no\\nconnection with it; and there warn\u2019t no floor to the shed, nor nothing\\nin it but some old rusty played-out hoes and spades and picks and a\\ncrippled plow. The match went out, and so did we, and shoved in the\\nstaple again, and the door was locked as good as ever. Tom was joyful.\\nHe says;", "chunk_order_number": 1713, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:39:59Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1715, "name": "Chunk 1715", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XXXIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Then we started for the house, and I went in the back door\u2014you only\\nhave to pull a buckskin latch-string, they don\u2019t fasten the doors\u2014but\\nthat warn\u2019t romantical enough for Tom Sawyer; no way would do him but\\nhe must climb up the lightning-rod. But after he got up half way about\\nthree times, and missed fire and fell every time, and the last time\\nmost busted his brains out, he thought he\u2019d got to give it up; but\\nafter he was rested he allowed he would give her one more turn for\\nluck, and this time he made the trip.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T10:00:00Z"}

{"name": "Daybreak", "description": "Location during daytime", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cYou going, right here in the daybreak? _That_ warn\u2019t the plan.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1723, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:00Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1726", "description": "The text chunk.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, _Huck!_ En good _lan_\u2019! ain\u2019 dat Misto Tom?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1726, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1727, "name": "Chunk 1727", "description": "I just knowed how it would be; I just expected it. _I_ didn\u2019t know\\nnothing to do; and if I had I couldn\u2019t a done it, because that nigger\\nbusted in and says:", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "I just knowed how it would be; I just expected it. _I_ didn\u2019t know\\nnothing to do; and if I had I couldn\u2019t a done it, because that nigger\\nbusted in and says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1728, "text": "\\\"Why, de gracious sakes! do he know you genlmen?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1728", "description": "Text passage from chapter XXXIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, de gracious sakes! do he know you genlmen?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1729", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "We could see pretty well now. {"name": "Chunk 1729 Dialogue", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "We could see pretty well now. {"chunk_order_number": 1730, "text": "\u201cDoes _who_ know us?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1730", "description": "Text chunk from chapter XXXIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cDoes _who_ know us?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1731, "name": "Chunk 1731", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhy, dis-yer runaway nigger.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"content": "\\\"I don\u2019t reckon he does; but what put that into your head?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1732", "description": "Text passage", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cI don\u2019t reckon he does; but what put that into your head?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1732, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1733, "text": "\u201cWhat _put_ it dar? Didn\u2019 he jis\u2019 dis minute sing out like he knowed you?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1733", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXXIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat _put_ it dar? Didn\u2019 he jis\u2019 dis minute sing out like he knowed\\nyou?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"text": "Tom says, in a puzzled-up kind of way:", "name": "Chunk 1734", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Tom says, in a puzzled-up kind of way:", "chunk_order_number": 1734, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1735, "name": "Chunk 1735", "description": "\u201cWell, that\u2019s mighty curious. _Who_ sung out? _When_ did he sing out?_what_ did he sing out?\u201d And turns to me, perfectly ca\u2019m, and says, \u201cDid _you_ hear anybody sing out?\u201d", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, that\u2019s mighty curious. _Who_ sung out? _When_ did he sing out?\\n_what_ did he sing out?\u201d And turns to me, perfectly ca\u2019m, and says,\\n\u201cDid _you_ hear anybody sing out?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"name": "Singing Out", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, that\u2019s mighty curious. _Who_ sung out? _When_ did he sing out?\\n_what_ did he sing out?\u201d And turns to me, perfectly ca\u2019m, and says,\\n\u201cDid _you_ hear anybody sing out?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1735, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1736, "name": "Of course there warn\u2019t nothing to be said but the one thing; so I says:", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Of course there warn\u2019t nothing to be said but the one thing; so I says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T15:20:00Z"}

{"text": "\u201cNo; _I_ ain\u2019t heard nobody say nothing.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1737", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo; _I_ ain\u2019t heard nobody say nothing.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1737, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:01Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1738, "name": "Chunk 1738", "description": "Then he turns to Jim, and looks him over like he never see him before, and says:", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Then he turns to Jim, and looks him over like he never see him before,\\nand says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:40:02Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1738, "name": "Chunk 1739", "description": "then he turns to Jim, and looks him over like he never see him before, and says:", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Then he turns to Jim, and looks him over like he never see him before,\\nand says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:40:02Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1740, "name": "Chunk_1740", "description": "\\\\\"No, sah,\\\\\" says Jim; \\\\\"_I_ hain't said nothing, sah.\\\\\"", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, sah,\u201d says Jim; \u201c_I_ hain\u2019t said nothing, sah.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T12:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1741, "text": "\u201cNot a word?\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1741", "description": "Text chunk from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNot a word?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T15:00:00Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1742, "name": "Chunk 1742", "description": "\\\\\"No, sah, I hain\u2019t said a word.\\\\\"", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, sah, I hain\u2019t said a word.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:02Z"}

{"order_number": 1743, "name": "Chunk 1743", "description": "Text passage from CHAPTER XXXIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cDid you ever see us before?\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1743, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:02Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1744, "name": "Chunk 1744", "description": "Text segment from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, sah; not as _I_ knows on.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:03Z"}

{"name": "sah", "description": "Character in the chunk", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cNo, sah; not as _I_ knows on.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1744, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:03Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1745, "text": "So Tom turns to the nigger, which was looking wild and distressed, and says, kind of severe:", "name": "Chunk 1745", "description": "Text content passage from CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "So Tom turns to the nigger, which was looking wild and distressed, and\\nsays, kind of severe:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-11-02T16:40:03Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1746, "text": "\\\"What do you reckon\u2019s the matter with you, anyway? What made you think somebody sung out?\\\"", "name": "Chunk 1746", "description": "Text chunk from chapter XXXIV", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cWhat do you reckon\u2019s the matter with you, anyway? What made you think\\nsomebody sung out?\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:03Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1747, "text": "\u201cOh, it\u2019s de dad-blame\u2019 witches, sah, en I wisht I was dead, I do. Dey\u2019s awluz at it, sah, en dey do mos\u2019 kill me, dey sk\u2019yers me so. Please to don\u2019t tell nobody \u2019bout it sah, er ole Mars Silas he\u2019ll scole me; \u2019kase he say dey _ain\u2019t_ no witches. I jis\u2019 wish to goodness he was heah now\u2014_den_ what would he say! I jis\u2019 bet he couldn\u2019 fine no way to git aroun\u2019 it _dis_ time. But it\u2019s awluz jis\u2019 so; people dat\u2019s _sot_, stays sot; dey won\u2019t look into noth\u2019n\u2019en fine it out f\u2019r deyselves, en when _you_ fine it out en tell um \u2019bout it, dey doan\u2019 b\u2019lieve you.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1747", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cOh, it\u2019s de dad-blame\u2019 witches, sah, en I wisht I was dead, I do.\\nDey\u2019s awluz at it, sah, en dey do mos\u2019 kill me, dey sk\u2019yers me so.\\nPlease to don\u2019t tell nobody \u2019bout it sah, er ole Mars Silas he\u2019ll scole\\nme; \u2019kase he say dey _ain\u2019t_ no witches. I jis\u2019 wish to goodness he was\\nheah now\u2014_den_ what would he say! I jis\u2019 bet he couldn\u2019 fine no way to\\ngit aroun\u2019 it _dis_ time. But it\u2019s awluz jis\u2019 so; people dat\u2019s _sot_,\\nstays sot; dey won\u2019t look into noth\u2019n\u2019en fine it out f\u2019r deyselves, en\\nwhen _you_ fine it out en tell um \u2019bout it, dey doan\u2019 b\u2019lieve you.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:40:03Z"}

{"name": "Mars Silas", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cOh, it\u2019s de dad-blame\u2019 witches, sah, en I wisht I was dead, I do.\\nDey\u2019s awluz at it, sah, en dey do mos\u2019 kill me, dey sk\u2019yers me so.\\nPlease to don\u2019t tell nobody \u2019bout it sah, er ole Mars Silas he\u2019ll scole\\nme; \u2019kase he say dey _ain\u2019t_ no witches. I jis\u2019 wish to goodness he was\\nheah now\u2014_den_ what would he say! I jis\u2019 bet he couldn\u2019 fine no way to\\ngit aroun\u2019 it _dis_ time. But it\u2019s awluz jis\u2019 so; people dat\u2019s _sot_,\\nstays sot; dey won\u2019t look into noth\u2019n\u2019en fine it out f\u2019r deyselves, en\\nwhen _you_ fine it out en tell um \u2019bout it, dey doan\u2019 b\u2019lieve you.\u201d", "chunk_order_number": 1747, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-10-27T16:40:03Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1748, "name": "Chunk 1748", "description": "Text segment from the chapter", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Tom give him a dime, and said we wouldn\u2019t tell nobody; and told him to\\nbuy some more thread to tie up his wool with; and then looks at Jim,\\nand says:", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:03Z"}

{"name": "dime", "description": "A coin", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Tom give him a dime, and said we wouldn\u2019t tell nobody; and told him to\\nbuy some more thread to tie up his wool with; and then looks at Jim,\\nand says:", "chunk_order_number": 1748, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:03Z"}

{"name": "Chunk 1749", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cI wonder if Uncle Silas is going to hang this nigger. If I was to\\ncatch a nigger that was ungrateful enough to run away, _I_ wouldn\u2019t\\ngive him up, I\u2019d hang him.\u201d And whilst the nigger stepped to the door\\nto look at the dime and bite it to see if it was good, he whispers to\\nJim and says:", "chunk_order_number": 1749, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:03Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1750, "text": "\u201cDon\u2019t ever let on to know us. And if you hear any digging going on\\nnights, it\u2019s us; we\u2019re going to set you free.\u201d", "name": "Chunk 1750", "description": "Text passage from Chapter XXXIV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "\u201cDon\u2019t ever let on to know us. And if you hear any digging going on\\nnights, it\u2019s us; we\u2019re going to set you free.\u201d", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2024-02-29T12:34:56Z"}

{"chunk_order_number": 1751, "name": "Chunk 1751", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXIV.", "chunk": "Jim only had time to grab us by the hand and squeeze it; then the\\nnigger come back, and we said we\u2019d come again some time if the nigger\\nwanted us to; and he said he would, more particular if it was dark,\\nbecause the witches went for him mostly in the dark, and it was good to\\nhave folks around then.", "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:03Z"}

We fetched an armful and hid it in the weeds, and set down\\nto rest, and Tom says, kind of dissatisfied:", "chunk_order_number": 1752, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0, "timestamp": "2025-06-01T16:40:03Z"}

{"name": "chain", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXV.", "chunk": "\u201cBlame it, this whole thing is just as easy and awkward as it can be.\\nAnd so it makes it so rotten difficult to get up a difficult plan.\\nThere ain\u2019t no watchman to be drugged\u2014now there _ought_ to be a\\nwatchman. There ain\u2019t even a dog to give a sleeping-mixture to. And\\nthere\u2019s Jim chained by one leg, with a ten-foot chain, to the leg of\\nhis bed: why, all you got to do is to lift up the bedstead and slip off\\nthe chain. And Uncle Silas he trusts everybody; sends the key to the\\npunkin-headed nigger, and don\u2019t send nobody to watch the nigger. Jim\\ncould a got out of that window-hole before this, only there wouldn\u2019t be\\nno use trying to travel with a ten-foot chain on his leg. Why, drat it,\\nHuck, it\u2019s the stupidest arrangement I ever see. You got to invent\\n_all_ the difficulties. Well, we can\u2019t help it; we got to do the best\\nwe can with the materials we\u2019ve got. Anyhow, there\u2019s one thing\u2014there\u2019s\\nmore honor in getting him out through a lot of difficulties and\\ndangers, where ther...", "chunk_order_number": 1753, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}

{"name": "Chunk_1757", "description": "Text Chunk from CHAPTER XXXV.", "chapter": "CHAPTER XXXV.", "chunk": "\u201cWell, if that ain\u2019t just like you, Huck Finn. You _can_ get up the\\ninfant-schooliest ways of going at a thing. Why, hain\u2019t you ever read\\nany books at all?\u2014Baron Trenck, nor Casanova, nor Benvenuto Chelleeny,\\nnor Henri IV., nor none of them heroes? Who ever heard of getting a\\nprisoner loose in such an old-maidy way as that? No; the way all the\\nbest authorities does is to saw the bed-leg in two, and leave it just\\nso, and swallow the sawdust, so it can\u2019t be found, and put some dirt\\nand grease around the sawed place so the very keenest seneskal can\u2019t\\nsee no sign of it\u2019s being sawed, and thinks the bed-leg is perfectly\\nsound. Then, the night you\u2019re ready, fetch the leg a kick, down she\\ngoes; slip off your chain, and there you are. Nothing to do but hitch\\nyour rope ladder to the battlements, shin down it, break your leg in\\nthe moat\u2014because a rope ladder is nineteen foot too short, you know\u2014and\\nthere\u2019s your horses and your trusty vassles, and they scoop you up and\\nfling you ...", "chunk_order_number": 1757, "author": "Mark Twain", "book": "ADVENTURES OF HUCKLEBERRY FINN", "chunk_index": 0}
